ExcludeVerboseContent.documentation: Set to TRUE to exclude sections that contain information such as headers, context, and evaluated mapping templates, regardless of logging level.

AwsAppSyncGraphQlApiLogConfigDetails.documentation: Specifies the logging configuration when writing GraphQL operations and tracing to Amazon CloudWatch for an AppSync GraphQL API.

AuthTtL.documentation: The number of milliseconds that a token is valid after being authenticated.

ClientId.documentation: The client identifier of the relying party at the OpenID identity provider. This identifier is typically obtained when the relying party is registered with the OpenID identity provider. You can specify a regular expression so that AppSync can validate against multiple client identifiers at a time.

IatTtL.documentation: The number of milliseconds that a token is valid after it's issued to a user.

Issuer.documentation: The issuer for the OIDC configuration. The issuer returned by discovery must exactly match the value of iss in the ID token.

AwsAppSyncGraphQlApiOpenIdConnectConfigD.documentation: Specifies the authorization configuration for using an OpenID Connect compliant service with your AppSync GraphQL API endpoint.

AppIdClientRegex.documentation: A regular expression for validating the incoming Amazon Cognito user pools app client ID. If this value isn't set, no filtering is applied.

AwsRegion.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region in which the user pool was created.

DefaultAction.documentation: The action that you want your GraphQL API to take when a request that uses Amazon Cognito user pools authentication doesn't match the Amazon Cognito user pools configuration.

AwsAppSyncGraphQlApiUserPoolConfigDetail.documentation: Specifies the authorization configuration for using Amazon Cognito user pools with your AppSync GraphQL API endpoint.

ResultConfiguration.documentation: The location in Amazon S3 where query and calculation results are stored and the encryption option, if any, used for query and calculation results. These are known as client-side settings. If workgroup settings override client-side settings, then the query uses the workgroup settings.

AwsAthenaWorkGroupConfigurationDetails.documentation: The configuration of the workgroup, which includes the location in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) where query results are stored, the encryption option, if any, used for query results, whether Amazon CloudWatch metrics are enabled for the workgroup, and the limit for the amount of bytes scanned (cutoff) per query, if it is specified.

EncryptionConfiguration.documentation: Specifies the method used to encrypt the user’s data stores in the Athena workgroup.

AwsAthenaWorkGroupConfigurationResultCon.documentation: The location in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) where query and calculation results are stored and the encryption option, if any, used for query and calculation results. These are known as client-side settings. If workgroup settings override client-side settings, then the query uses the workgroup settings.

EncryptionOption.documentation: Indicates whether Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) server-side encryption with Amazon S3 managed keys (SSE_S3), server-side encryption with KMS keys (SSE_KMS), or client-side encryption with KMS customer managed keys (CSE_KMS) is used.

KmsKey.documentation: For SSE_KMS and CSE_KMS, this is the KMS key Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or ID.

AwsAthenaWorkGroupConfigurationResultCon.documentation: Specifies the method used to encrypt the user’s data stores in the Athena workgroup.

Name.documentation: The workgroup name.

State.documentation: Whether the workgroup is enabled or disabled.

Configuration.documentation: The configuration of the workgroup, which includes the location in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) where query results are stored, the encryption option, if any, used for query results, whether Amazon CloudWatch metrics are enabled for the workgroup, and the limit for the amount of bytes scanned (cutoff) per query, if it is specified.

AwsAthenaWorkGroupDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon Athena workgroup.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupAvailabili.documentation: An Availability Zone for the automatic scaling group.

LoadBalancerNames.documentation: The list of load balancers associated with the group.

HealthCheckType.documentation: The service to use for the health checks. Valid values are EC2 or ELB.

HealthCheckGracePeriod.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, that Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling waits before it checks the health status of an EC2 instance that has come into service.

CreatedTime.documentation:
Indicates when the auto scaling group was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

MixedInstancesPolicy.documentation: The mixed instances policy for the automatic scaling group.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The list of Availability Zones for the automatic scaling group.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupDetails.documentation: Provides details about an auto scaling group.

LaunchTemplateId.documentation: The identifier of the launch template. You must specify either LaunchTemplateId or LaunchTemplateName.

LaunchTemplateName.documentation: The name of the launch template. You must specify either LaunchTemplateId or LaunchTemplateName.

Version.documentation: Identifies the version of the launch template. You can specify a version identifier, or use the values $Latest or $Default.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupLaunchTemp.documentation: Details about the launch template to use.

InstancesDistribution.documentation: The instances distribution. The instances distribution specifies the distribution of On-Demand Instances and Spot Instances, the maximum price to pay for Spot Instances, and how the Auto Scaling group allocates instance types to fulfill On-Demand and Spot capacity.

LaunchTemplate.documentation: The launch template to use and the instance types (overrides) to use to provision EC2 instances to fulfill On-Demand and Spot capacities.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupMixedInsta.documentation: The mixed instances policy for the automatic scaling group.

OnDemandAllocationStrategy.documentation: How to allocate instance types to fulfill On-Demand capacity. The valid value is prioritized.

OnDemandBaseCapacity.documentation: The minimum amount of the Auto Scaling group's capacity that must be fulfilled by On-Demand Instances.

OnDemandPercentageAboveBaseCapacity.documentation: The percentage of On-Demand Instances and Spot Instances for additional capacity beyond OnDemandBaseCapacity.

SpotAllocationStrategy.documentation:
How to allocate instances across Spot Instance pools. Valid values are as follows:

  • lowest-price

  • capacity-optimized

  • capacity-optimized-prioritized

SpotInstancePools.documentation: The number of Spot Instance pools across which to allocate your Spot Instances.

SpotMaxPrice.documentation: The maximum price per unit hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance.

LaunchTemplateSpecification.documentation: The launch template to use for a mixed instances policy.

Overrides.documentation: Property values to use to override the values in the launch template.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupMixedInsta.documentation: Describes a launch template and overrides for a mixed instances policy.

LaunchTemplateId.documentation: The identifier of the launch template. You must specify either LaunchTemplateId or LaunchTemplateName.

LaunchTemplateName.documentation: The name of the launch template. You must specify either LaunchTemplateId or LaunchTemplateName.

Version.documentation: Identifies the version of the launch template. You can specify a version identifier, or use the values $Latest or $Default.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupMixedInsta.documentation: Details about the launch template to use for a mixed instances policy.

WeightedCapacity.documentation: The number of capacity units provided by the specified instance type in terms of virtual CPUs, memory, storage, throughput, or other relative performance characteristic.

AwsAutoScalingAutoScalingGroupMixedInsta.documentation: Property values to use to override the values in the launch template.

DeviceName.documentation: The device name that is exposed to the EC2 instance. For example, /dev/sdh or xvdh.

Ebs.documentation: Parameters that are used to automatically set up Amazon EBS volumes when an instance is launched.

NoDevice.documentation:
Whether to suppress the device that is included in the block device mapping of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI).

If NoDevice is true, then you cannot specify Ebs.>

VirtualName.documentation:
The name of the virtual device (for example, ephemeral0).

You can provide either VirtualName or Ebs, but not both.

DeleteOnTermination.documentation: Whether to delete the volume when the instance is terminated.

Iops.documentation:
The number of input/output (I/O) operations per second (IOPS) to provision for the volume.

Only supported for gp3 or io1 volumes. Required for io1 volumes. Not used with standard, gp2, st1, or sc1 volumes.

SnapshotId.documentation:
The snapshot ID of the volume to use.

You must specify either VolumeSize or SnapshotId.

VolumeSize.documentation:
The volume size, in GiBs. The following are the supported volumes sizes for each volume type:

  • gp2 and gp3: 1-16,384

  • io1: 4-16,384

  • st1 and sc1: 125-16,384

  • standard: 1-1,024

You must specify either SnapshotId or VolumeSize. If you specify both SnapshotId and VolumeSize, the volume size must be equal or greater than the size of the snapshot.

VolumeType.documentation:
The volume type. Valid values are as follows:

  • gp2

  • gp3

  • io1

  • sc1

  • st1

  • standard

AwsAutoScalingLaunchConfigurationBlockDe.documentation: Parameters that are used to automatically set up EBS volumes when an instance is launched.

AssociatePublicIpAddress.documentation: For Auto Scaling groups that run in a VPC, specifies whether to assign a public IP address to the group's instances.

BlockDeviceMappings.documentation: Specifies the block devices for the instance.

ClassicLinkVpcId.documentation: The identifier of a ClassicLink-enabled VPC that EC2-Classic instances are linked to.

ClassicLinkVpcSecurityGroups.documentation: The identifiers of one or more security groups for the VPC that is specified in ClassicLinkVPCId.

CreatedTime.documentation:
The creation date and time for the launch configuration.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

EbsOptimized.documentation: Whether the launch configuration is optimized for Amazon EBS I/O.

IamInstanceProfile.documentation: The name or the ARN of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance. The instance profile contains the IAM role.

ImageId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that is used to launch EC2 instances.

InstanceMonitoring.documentation: Indicates the type of monitoring for instances in the group.

KernelId.documentation: The identifier of the kernel associated with the AMI.

PlacementTenancy.documentation: The tenancy of the instance. An instance with dedicated tenancy runs on isolated, single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.

RamdiskId.documentation: The identifier of the RAM disk associated with the AMI.

SecurityGroups.documentation: The security groups to assign to the instances in the Auto Scaling group.

SpotPrice.documentation: The maximum hourly price to be paid for any Spot Instance that is launched to fulfill the request.

UserData.documentation: The user data to make available to the launched EC2 instances. Must be base64-encoded text.

Enabled.documentation:
If set to true, then instances in the group launch with detailed monitoring.

If set to false, then instances in the group launch with basic monitoring.

AwsAutoScalingLaunchConfigurationInstanc.documentation: Information about the type of monitoring for instances in the group.

HttpEndpoint.documentation: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances. By default, the metadata endpoint is enabled.

HttpPutResponseHopLimit.documentation: The HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel.

HttpTokens.documentation: Indicates whether token usage is required or optional for metadata requests. By default, token usage is optional.

BackupOptions.documentation:
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs. Valid values are as follows:

  • Set to WindowsVSS: enabled to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.

  • Set to WindowsVSS: disabled to create a regular backup. The WindowsVSS option is not enabled by default.

ResourceType.documentation:
The name of a resource type. The only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows VSS.

The only valid value is EC2.

AwsBackupBackupPlanAdvancedBackupSetting.documentation: Provides a list of backup options for each resource type.

BackupPlanName.documentation: The display name of a backup plan.

AdvancedBackupSettings.documentation: A list of backup options for each resource type.

BackupPlanRule.documentation: An array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.

AwsBackupBackupPlanBackupPlanDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Backup backup plan and an array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.

BackupPlan.documentation: Uniquely identifies the backup plan to be associated with the selection of resources.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the backup plan.

BackupPlanId.documentation: A unique ID for the backup plan.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings. Version IDs cannot be edited.

AwsBackupBackupPlanDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Backup backup plan and an array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.

DeleteAfterDays.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.

MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.

AwsBackupBackupPlanLifecycleDetails.documentation: Provides lifecycle details for the backup plan. A lifecycle defines when a backup is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires.

DestinationBackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination backup vault for the copied backup.

Lifecycle.documentation:
Defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define. If you don't specify a lifecycle, Backup applies the lifecycle policy of the source backup to the destination backup.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days.

AwsBackupBackupPlanRuleCopyActionsDetail.documentation: An array of CopyAction objects, each of which contains details of the copy operation.

TargetBackupVault.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the Amazon Web Services account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of letters, numbers, and hyphens.

StartWindowMinutes.documentation: A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully.

ScheduleExpression.documentation: A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup job.

RuleName.documentation: A display name for a backup rule. Must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

RuleId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.

EnableContinuousBackup.documentation: Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR).

CompletionWindowMinutes.documentation: A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed, or it is canceled by Backup.

CopyActions.documentation: An array of CopyAction objects, each of which contains details of the copy operation.

Lifecycle.documentation:
Defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define. If you don't specify a lifecycle, Backup applies the lifecycle policy of the source backup to the destination backup.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days.

AwsBackupBackupPlanRuleDetails.documentation: Provides details about an array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the Amazon Web Services account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The unique ARN associated with the server-side encryption key. You can specify a key to encrypt your backups from services that support full Backup management. If you don't specify a key, Backup creates an KMS key for you by default.

Notifications.documentation: The Amazon SNS event notifications for the specified backup vault.

AccessPolicy.documentation: A resource-based policy that is used to manage access permissions on the target backup vault.

AwsBackupBackupVaultDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Backup backup vault. In Backup, a backup vault is a container that stores and organizes your backups.

BackupVaultEvents.documentation:
An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the backup vault. The following events are supported:

  • BACKUP_JOB_STARTED | BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED

  • COPY_JOB_STARTED | COPY_JOB_SUCCESSFUL | COPY_JOB_FAILED

  • RESTORE_JOB_STARTED | RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED | RECOVERY_POINT_MODIFIED

  • S3_BACKUP_OBJECT_FAILED | S3_RESTORE_OBJECT_FAILED

SnsTopicArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the Amazon SNS topic for a backup vault's events.

AwsBackupBackupVaultNotificationsDetails.documentation: Provides details about the Amazon SNS event notifications for the specified backup vault.

DeleteAt.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.

MoveToColdStorageAt.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.

AwsBackupRecoveryPointCalculatedLifecycl.documentation: Specifies how long in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is deleted.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan.

BackupPlanVersion.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.

BackupRuleId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a rule used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.

AwsBackupRecoveryPointCreatedByDetails.documentation: Contains information about the backup plan and rule that Backup used to initiate the recovery point backup.

BackupSizeInBytes.documentation: The size, in bytes, of a backup.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the Amazon Web Services account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date and time that a job to create a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and UTC. The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CreatedBy.documentation: Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery point, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan that is used to create it.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and UTC. The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The ARN for the server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point

IsEncrypted.documentation: A Boolean value that is returned as TRUE if the specified recovery point is encrypted, or FALSE if the recovery point is not encrypted.

LastRestoreTime.documentation: The date and time that a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and UTC. The value of LastRestoreTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

Lifecycle.documentation: The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of Amazon Web Services resource saved as a recovery point, such as an Amazon EBS volume or an Amazon RDS database.

SourceBackupVaultArn.documentation: The ARN for the backup vault where the recovery point was originally copied from. If the recovery point is restored to the same account, this value will be null.

Status.documentation:
A status code specifying the state of the recovery point. Valid values are as follows:

  • COMPLETED

  • DELETING

  • EXPIRED

  • PARTIAL

StatusMessage.documentation: A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion failure.

StorageClass.documentation:
Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are as follows:

  • COLD

  • DELETED

  • WARM

AwsBackupRecoveryPointDetails.documentation: Contains detailed information about the recovery points stored in an Backup backup vault. A backup, or recovery point, represents the content of a resource at a specified time.

DeleteAfterDays.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.

MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.

AwsBackupRecoveryPointLifecycleDetails.documentation: Contains an array of Transition objects specifying how long in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is deleted.

CertificateAuthorityArn.documentation: The ARN of the private certificate authority (CA) that will be used to issue the certificate.

CreatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the certificate was requested.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

DomainName.documentation: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN), such as www.example.com, that is secured by the certificate.

DomainValidationOptions.documentation:
Contains information about the initial validation of each domain name that occurs as a result of the RequestCertificate request.

Only provided if the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED.

ExtendedKeyUsages.documentation: Contains a list of Extended Key Usage X.509 v3 extension objects. Each object specifies a purpose for which the certificate public key can be used and consists of a name and an object identifier (OID).

FailureReason.documentation:
For a failed certificate request, the reason for the failure.

Valid values: NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS | ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED | DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED | INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN | DOMAIN_VALIDATION_DENIED | CAA_ERROR | PCA_LIMIT_EXCEEDED | PCA_INVALID_ARN | PCA_INVALID_STATE | PCA_REQUEST_FAILED | PCA_NAME_CONSTRAINTS_VALIDATION | PCA_RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND | PCA_INVALID_ARGS | PCA_INVALID_DURATION | PCA_ACCESS_DENIED | SLR_NOT_FOUND | OTHER

ImportedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the certificate was imported. Provided if the certificate type is IMPORTED.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

InUseBy.documentation: The list of ARNs for the Amazon Web Services resources that use the certificate.

IssuedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the certificate was issued. Provided if the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Issuer.documentation: The name of the certificate authority that issued and signed the certificate.

KeyAlgorithm.documentation:
The algorithm that was used to generate the public-private key pair.

Valid values: RSA_2048 | RSA_1024 | RSA_4096 | EC_prime256v1 | EC_secp384r1 | EC_secp521r1

KeyUsages.documentation: A list of key usage X.509 v3 extension objects.

NotAfter.documentation:
The time after which the certificate becomes invalid.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

NotBefore.documentation:
The time before which the certificate is not valid.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Options.documentation: Provides a value that specifies whether to add the certificate to a transparency log.

RenewalEligibility.documentation:
Whether the certificate is eligible for renewal.

Valid values: ELIGIBLE | INELIGIBLE

RenewalSummary.documentation: Information about the status of the Certificate Manager managed renewal for the certificate. Provided only when the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED.

SignatureAlgorithm.documentation: The algorithm that was used to sign the certificate.

Status.documentation:
The status of the certificate.

Valid values: PENDING_VALIDATION | ISSUED | INACTIVE | EXPIRED | VALIDATION_TIMED_OUT | REVOKED | FAILED

Subject.documentation: The name of the entity that is associated with the public key contained in the certificate.

SubjectAlternativeNames.documentation:
One or more domain names (subject alternative names) included in the certificate. This list contains the domain names that are bound to the public key that is contained in the certificate.

The subject alternative names include the canonical domain name (CN) of the certificate and additional domain names that can be used to connect to the website.

Type.documentation:
The source of the certificate. For certificates that Certificate Manager provides, Type is AMAZON_ISSUED. For certificates that are imported with ImportCertificate, Type is IMPORTED.

Valid values: IMPORTED | AMAZON_ISSUED | PRIVATE

AwsCertificateManagerCertificateDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Certificate Manager certificate.

DomainName.documentation: A fully qualified domain name (FQDN) in the certificate.

ResourceRecord.documentation: The CNAME record that is added to the DNS database for domain validation.

ValidationDomain.documentation: The domain name that Certificate Manager uses to send domain validation emails.

ValidationEmails.documentation: A list of email addresses that Certificate Manager uses to send domain validation emails.

ValidationMethod.documentation: The method used to validate the domain name.

ValidationStatus.documentation: The validation status of the domain name.

AwsCertificateManagerCertificateDomainVa.documentation:
Contains information about one of the following:

  • The initial validation of each domain name that occurs as a result of the RequestCertificate request

  • The validation of each domain name in the certificate, as it pertains to Certificate Manager managed renewal

Name.documentation: The name of an extension value. Indicates the purpose for which the certificate public key can be used.

OId.documentation:
An object identifier (OID) for the extension value.

The format is numbers separated by periods.

AwsCertificateManagerCertificateExtended.documentation: Contains information about an extended key usage X.509 v3 extension object.

Name.documentation: The key usage extension name.

AwsCertificateManagerCertificateKeyUsage.documentation: Contains information about a key usage X.509 v3 extension object.

CertificateTransparencyLoggingPreference.documentation:
Whether to add the certificate to a transparency log.

Valid values: DISABLED | ENABLED

DomainValidationOptions.documentation: Information about the validation of each domain name in the certificate, as it pertains to Certificate Manager managed renewal. Provided only when the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED.

RenewalStatus.documentation:
The status of the Certificate Manager managed renewal of the certificate.

Valid values: PENDING_AUTO_RENEWAL | PENDING_VALIDATION | SUCCESS | FAILED

RenewalStatusReason.documentation:
The reason that a renewal request was unsuccessful. This attribute is used only when RenewalStatus is FAILED.

Valid values: NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS | ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED | DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED | INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN | DOMAIN_VALIDATION_DENIED | CAA_ERROR | PCA_LIMIT_EXCEEDED | PCA_INVALID_ARN | PCA_INVALID_STATE | PCA_REQUEST_FAILED | PCA_NAME_CONSTRAINTS_VALIDATION | PCA_RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND | PCA_INVALID_ARGS | PCA_INVALID_DURATION | PCA_ACCESS_DENIED | SLR_NOT_FOUND | OTHER

UpdatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the renewal summary was last updated.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsCertificateManagerCertificateRenewalS.documentation: Contains information about the Certificate Manager managed renewal for an AMAZON_ISSUED certificate.

Name.documentation: The name of the resource.

Type.documentation: The type of resource.

AwsCertificateManagerCertificateResource.documentation: Provides details about the CNAME record that is added to the DNS database for domain validation.

CreationTime.documentation: The time at which the stack was created.

Description.documentation: A user-defined description associated with the stack.

DisableRollback.documentation: Boolean to enable or disable rollback on stack creation failures.

DriftInformation.documentation: Information about whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has drifted, from its expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.

EnableTerminationProtection.documentation: Whether termination protection is enabled for the stack.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time the nested stack was last updated. This field will only be returned if the stack has been updated at least once.

NotificationArns.documentation: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the Amazon SNS topic to which stack-related events are published.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of an IAM role that's associated with the stack.

StackStatusReason.documentation: Success or failure message associated with the stack status.

TimeoutInMinutes.documentation: The length of time, in minutes, that CloudFormation waits for the nested stack to reach the CREATE_COMPLETE state.

AwsCloudFormationStackDetails.documentation: Nests a stack as a resource in a top-level template. Nested stacks are stacks created as resources for another stack.

StackDriftStatus.documentation: Status of the stack's actual configuration compared to its expected template configuration.

AwsCloudFormationStackDriftInformationDe.documentation: Provides information about the stack's conformity to its expected template configuration.

Description.documentation: A user-defined description associated with the output.

AwsCloudFormationStackOutputsDetails.documentation: Provides information about the CloudFormation stack output.

ViewerProtocolPolicy.documentation:
The protocol that viewers can use to access the files in an origin. You can specify the following options:

  • allow-all - Viewers can use HTTP or HTTPS.

  • redirect-to-https - CloudFront responds to HTTP requests with an HTTP status code of 301 (Moved Permanently) and the HTTPS URL. The viewer then uses the new URL to resubmit.

  • https-only - CloudFront responds to HTTP request with an HTTP status code of 403 (Forbidden).

AwsCloudFrontDistributionCacheBehavior.documentation: Information about a cache behavior for the distribution.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionCacheBehaviors.documentation: Provides information about caching for the CloudFront distribution.

ViewerProtocolPolicy.documentation:
The protocol that viewers can use to access the files in an origin. You can specify the following options:

  • allow-all - Viewers can use HTTP or HTTPS.

  • redirect-to-https - CloudFront responds to HTTP requests with an HTTP status code of 301 (Moved Permanently) and the HTTPS URL. The viewer then uses the new URL to resubmit.

  • https-only - CloudFront responds to HTTP request with an HTTP status code of 403 (Forbidden).

AwsCloudFrontDistributionDefaultCacheBeh.documentation: Contains information about the default cache configuration for the CloudFront distribution.

CacheBehaviors.documentation: Provides information about the cache configuration for the distribution.

DefaultCacheBehavior.documentation: The default cache behavior for the configuration.

DefaultRootObject.documentation: The object that CloudFront sends in response to requests from the origin (for example, index.html) when a viewer requests the root URL for the distribution (http://www.example.com) instead of an object in your distribution (http://www.example.com/product-description.html).

DomainName.documentation: The domain name corresponding to the distribution.

ETag.documentation: The entity tag is a hash of the object.

LastModifiedTime.documentation:
Indicates when that the distribution was last modified.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Logging.documentation: A complex type that controls whether access logs are written for the distribution.

Origins.documentation: A complex type that contains information about origins for this distribution.

OriginGroups.documentation: Provides information about the origin groups in the distribution.

ViewerCertificate.documentation: Provides information about the TLS/SSL configuration that the distribution uses to communicate with viewers.

Status.documentation: Indicates the current status of the distribution.

WebAclId.documentation: A unique identifier that specifies the WAF web ACL, if any, to associate with this distribution.

Bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket to store the access logs in.

Enabled.documentation: With this field, you can enable or disable the selected distribution.

IncludeCookies.documentation: Specifies whether you want CloudFront to include cookies in access logs.

Prefix.documentation: An optional string that you want CloudFront to use as a prefix to the access log filenames for this distribution.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionLogging.documentation: A complex type that controls whether access logs are written for the CloudFront distribution.

HttpPort.documentation: The HTTP port that CloudFront uses to connect to the origin.

HttpsPort.documentation: The HTTPS port that CloudFront uses to connect to the origin.

OriginKeepaliveTimeout.documentation: Specifies how long, in seconds, CloudFront persists its connection to the origin.

OriginProtocolPolicy.documentation: Specifies the protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) that CloudFront uses to connect to the origin.

OriginReadTimeout.documentation: Specifies how long, in seconds, CloudFront waits for a response from the origin.

OriginSslProtocols.documentation: Specifies the minimum SSL/TLS protocol that CloudFront uses when connecting to your origin over HTTPS.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginCustomOri.documentation: A custom origin. A custom origin is any origin that is not an Amazon S3 bucket, with one exception. An Amazon S3 bucket that is configured with static website hosting is a custom origin.

FailoverCriteria.documentation: Provides the criteria for an origin group to fail over.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginGroup.documentation: Information about an origin group for the CloudFront distribution.

StatusCodes.documentation: Information about the status codes that cause an origin group to fail over.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginGroupFail.documentation: Provides information about when an origin group fails over.

Items.documentation: The list of status code values that can cause a failover to the next origin.

Quantity.documentation: The number of status codes that can cause a failover.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginGroupFail.documentation: The status codes that cause an origin group to fail over.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginGroups.documentation: Provides information about origin groups that are associated with the CloudFront distribution.

DomainName.documentation: Amazon S3 origins: The DNS name of the S3 bucket from which you want CloudFront to get objects for this origin.

Id.documentation: A unique identifier for the origin or origin group.

OriginPath.documentation: An optional element that causes CloudFront to request your content from a directory in your Amazon S3 bucket or your custom origin.

S3OriginConfig.documentation: An origin that is an S3 bucket that is not configured with static website hosting.

CustomOriginConfig.documentation: An origin that is not an Amazon S3 bucket, with one exception. If the Amazon S3 bucket is configured with static website hosting, use this attribute. If the Amazon S3 bucket is not configured with static website hosting, use the S3OriginConfig type instead.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginItem.documentation: A complex type that describes the Amazon S3 bucket, HTTP server (for example, a web server), Elemental MediaStore, or other server from which CloudFront gets your files.

OriginAccessIdentity.documentation: The CloudFront origin access identity to associate with the origin.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginS3OriginC.documentation: Information about an origin that is an Amazon S3 bucket that is not configured with static website hosting.

Items.documentation: A list that contains allowed SSL/TLS protocols for this distribution.

Quantity.documentation: The number of SSL/TLS protocols that you want to allow CloudFront to use when establishing an HTTPS connection with this origin.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOriginSslProtoc.documentation: A complex type that contains information about the SSL/TLS protocols that CloudFront can use when establishing an HTTPS connection with your origin.

Items.documentation: A complex type that contains origins or origin groups for this distribution.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionOrigins.documentation: A complex type that contains information about origins and origin groups for this CloudFront distribution.

AcmCertificateArn.documentation: The ARN of the ACM certificate. Used if the certificate is stored in ACM. If you provide an ACM certificate ARN, you must also provide MinimumCertificateVersion and SslSupportMethod.

Certificate.documentation: The identifier of the certificate. Note that in CloudFront, this attribute is deprecated.

CertificateSource.documentation: The source of the certificate identified by Certificate. Note that in CloudFront, this attribute is deprecated.

CloudFrontDefaultCertificate.documentation: Whether the distribution uses the CloudFront domain name. If set to false, then you provide either AcmCertificateArn or IamCertificateId.

IamCertificateId.documentation: The identifier of the IAM certificate. Used if the certificate is stored in IAM. If you provide IamCertificateId, then you also must provide MinimumProtocolVersion and SslSupportMethod.

MinimumProtocolVersion.documentation: The security policy that CloudFront uses for HTTPS connections with viewers. If SslSupportMethod is sni-only, then MinimumProtocolVersion must be TLSv1 or higher.

SslSupportMethod.documentation: The viewers that the distribution accepts HTTPS connections from.

AwsCloudFrontDistributionViewerCertifica.documentation: Provides information about the TLS/SSL configuration that the CloudFront distribution uses to communicate with viewers.

CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the log group that CloudTrail logs are delivered to.

CloudWatchLogsRoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that the CloudWatch Events endpoint assumes when it writes to the log group.

HasCustomEventSelectors.documentation: Indicates whether the trail has custom event selectors.

HomeRegion.documentation: The Region where the trail was created.

IncludeGlobalServiceEvents.documentation: Indicates whether the trail publishes events from global services such as IAM to the log files.

IsMultiRegionTrail.documentation: Indicates whether the trail applies only to the current Region or to all Regions.

IsOrganizationTrail.documentation: Whether the trail is created for all accounts in an organization in Organizations, or only for the current Amazon Web Services account.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The KMS key ID to use to encrypt the logs.

LogFileValidationEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether CloudTrail log file validation is enabled.

Name.documentation: The name of the trail.

S3BucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are published.

S3KeyPrefix.documentation: The S3 key prefix. The key prefix is added after the name of the S3 bucket where the log files are published.

SnsTopicArn.documentation: The ARN of the SNS topic that is used for notifications of log file delivery.

SnsTopicName.documentation: The name of the SNS topic that is used for notifications of log file delivery.

ActionsEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state.

AlarmActions.documentation: The list of actions, specified as Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state.

AlarmConfigurationUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time stamp of the last update to the alarm configuration.

AlarmName.documentation: The name of the alarm. If you don't specify a name, CloudFront generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the alarm name.

ComparisonOperator.documentation: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold. The specified statistic value is used as the first operand.

DatapointsToAlarm.documentation: The number of datapoints that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

Dimensions.documentation: The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm.

EvaluateLowSampleCountPercentile.documentation: Used only for alarms based on percentiles. If ignore, the alarm state does not change during periods with too few data points to be statistically significant. If evaluate or this parameter is not used, the alarm is always evaluated and possibly changes state no matter how many data points are available.

EvaluationPeriods.documentation: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

ExtendedStatistic.documentation: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.

InsufficientDataActions.documentation: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an ARN.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metric associated with the alarm. This is required for an alarm based on a metric. For an alarm based on a math expression, you use Metrics instead and you can't specify MetricName.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace of the metric associated with the alarm. This is required for an alarm based on a metric. For an alarm based on a math expression, you can't specify Namespace and you use Metrics instead.

OkActions.documentation: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an ARN.

Period.documentation: The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. This is required for an alarm based on a metric.

Statistic.documentation:
The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile. For percentile statistics, use ExtendedStatistic.

For an alarm based on a metric, you must specify either Statistic or ExtendedStatistic but not both.

For an alarm based on a math expression, you can't specify Statistic. Instead, you use Metrics.

Threshold.documentation: The value to compare with the specified statistic.

ThresholdMetricId.documentation: n an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

TreatMissingData.documentation: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points.

Unit.documentation: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

AwsCloudWatchAlarmDetails.documentation: Specifies an alarm and associates it with the specified metric or metric math expression.

Name.documentation: The name of a dimension.

AwsCloudWatchAlarmDimensionsDetails.documentation: Details about the dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm.

EncryptionDisabled.documentation: Indicates whether to disable encryption on the artifact. Only valid when Type is S3.

Location.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The name of the S3 bucket where the artifact is located.

Name.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The name of the artifact. Used with NamepaceType and Path to determine the pattern for storing the artifact.

NamespaceType.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The value to use for the namespace. Used with Name and Path to determine the pattern for storing the artifact.

OverrideArtifactName.documentation: Whether the name specified in the buildspec file overrides the artifact name.

Packaging.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The type of output artifact to create.

Path.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The path to the artifact. Used with Name and NamespaceType to determine the pattern for storing the artifact.

Type.documentation: The type of build artifact.

AwsCodeBuildProjectArtifactsDetails.documentation: Information about the build artifacts for the CodeBuild project.

EncryptionKey.documentation:
The KMS key used to encrypt the build output artifacts.

You can specify either the ARN of the KMS key or, if available, the KMS key alias (using the format alias/alias-name).

Artifacts.documentation: Information about the build artifacts for the CodeBuild project.

Environment.documentation: Information about the build environment for this build project.

Name.documentation: The name of the build project.

Source.documentation: Information about the build input source code for this build project.

ServiceRole.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that enables CodeBuild to interact with dependent Amazon Web Services services on behalf of the Amazon Web Services account.

LogsConfig.documentation: Information about logs for the build project.

VpcConfig.documentation: Information about the VPC configuration that CodeBuild accesses.

SecondaryArtifacts.documentation: Information about the secondary artifacts for the CodeBuild project.

Certificate.documentation: The certificate to use with this build project.

EnvironmentVariables.documentation: A set of environment variables to make available to builds for the build project.

PrivilegedMode.documentation: Whether to allow the Docker daemon to run inside a Docker container. Set to true if the build project is used to build Docker images.

ImagePullCredentialsType.documentation:
The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your build.

Valid values:

  • CODEBUILD specifies that CodeBuild uses its own credentials. This requires that you modify your ECR repository policy to trust the CodeBuild service principal.

  • SERVICE_ROLE specifies that CodeBuild uses your build project's service role.

When you use a cross-account or private registry image, you must use SERVICE_ROLE credentials. When you use an CodeBuild curated image, you must use CODEBUILD credentials.

RegistryCredential.documentation: The credentials for access to a private registry.

Type.documentation:
The type of build environment to use for related builds.

The environment type ARM_CONTAINER is available only in Regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (Ohio), US West (Oregon), Europe (Ireland), Asia Pacific (Mumbai), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Sydney), and Europe (Frankfurt).

The environment type LINUX_CONTAINER with compute type build.general1.2xlarge is available only in Regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (N. Virginia), US West (Oregon), Canada (Central), Europe (Ireland), Europe (London), Europe (Frankfurt), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), China (Beijing), and China (Ningxia).

The environment type LINUX_GPU_CONTAINER is available only in Regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (N. Virginia), US West (Oregon), Canada (Central), Europe (Ireland), Europe (London), Europe (Frankfurt), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), China (Beijing), and China (Ningxia).

Valid values: WINDOWS_CONTAINER | LINUX_CONTAINER | LINUX_GPU_CONTAINER | ARM_CONTAINER

AwsCodeBuildProjectEnvironment.documentation: Information about the build environment for this build project.

Name.documentation: The name of the environment variable.

Type.documentation: The type of environment variable.

AwsCodeBuildProjectEnvironmentEnvironmen.documentation: Information about an environment variable that is available to builds for the build project.

Credential.documentation:
The ARN or name of credentials created using Secrets Manager.

The credential can use the name of the credentials only if they exist in your current Amazon Web Services Region.

CredentialProvider.documentation:
The service that created the credentials to access a private Docker registry.

The valid value, SECRETS_MANAGER, is for Secrets Manager.

AwsCodeBuildProjectEnvironmentRegistryCr.documentation: The credentials for access to a private registry.

GroupName.documentation: The group name of the logs in CloudWatch Logs.

Status.documentation: The current status of the logs in CloudWatch Logs for a build project.

StreamName.documentation: The prefix of the stream name of the CloudWatch Logs.

AwsCodeBuildProjectLogsConfigCloudWatchL.documentation: Information about CloudWatch Logs for the build project.

CloudWatchLogs.documentation: Information about CloudWatch Logs for the build project.

S3Logs.documentation: Information about logs built to an S3 bucket for a build project.

AwsCodeBuildProjectLogsConfigDetails.documentation: Information about logs for the build project.

EncryptionDisabled.documentation: Whether to disable encryption of the S3 build log output.

Location.documentation: The ARN of the S3 bucket and the path prefix for S3 logs.

Status.documentation: The current status of the S3 build logs.

AwsCodeBuildProjectLogsConfigS3LogsDetai.documentation: Information about logs built to an S3 bucket for a build project.

Type.documentation:
The type of repository that contains the source code to be built. Valid values are:

  • BITBUCKET - The source code is in a Bitbucket repository.

  • CODECOMMIT - The source code is in an CodeCommit repository.

  • CODEPIPELINE - The source code settings are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline.

  • GITHUB - The source code is in a GitHub repository.

  • GITHUB_ENTERPRISE - The source code is in a GitHub Enterprise repository.

  • NO_SOURCE - The project does not have input source code.

  • S3 - The source code is in an S3 input bucket.

Location.documentation:
Information about the location of the source code to be built.

Valid values include:

  • For source code settings that are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline, location should not be specified. If it is specified, CodePipeline ignores it. This is because CodePipeline uses the settings in a pipeline's source action instead of this value.

  • For source code in an CodeCommit repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source code and the build spec file (for example, https://git-codecommit.region-ID.amazonaws.com/v1/repos/repo-name ).

  • For source code in an S3 input bucket, one of the following.

    • The path to the ZIP file that contains the source code (for example, bucket-name/path/to/object-name.zip).

    • The path to the folder that contains the source code (for example, bucket-name/path/to/source-code/folder/).

  • For source code in a GitHub repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source and the build spec file.

  • For source code in a Bitbucket repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source and the build spec file.

GitCloneDepth.documentation: Information about the Git clone depth for the build project.

InsecureSsl.documentation: Whether to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code.

AwsCodeBuildProjectSource.documentation: Information about the build input source code for this build project.

Subnets.documentation: A list of one or more subnet IDs in your VPC.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: A list of one or more security group IDs in your VPC.

AwsCodeBuildProjectVpcConfig.documentation: Information about the VPC configuration that CodeBuild accesses.

AllowCredentials.documentation: Indicates whether the CORS request includes credentials.

MaxAge.documentation: The number of seconds for which the browser caches preflight request results.

AwsCorsConfiguration.documentation: Contains the cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) configuration for the API. CORS is only supported for HTTP APIs.

CertificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the SSL certificate that encrypts connections between the DMS endpoint and the replication instance.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the endpoint database.

EndpointArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint.

EndpointType.documentation: The type of endpoint. Valid values are source and target.

EngineName.documentation: The type of engine for the endpoint, depending on the EndpointType value.

ExternalId.documentation: A value that can be used for cross-account validation.

ExtraConnectionAttributes.documentation: Additional attributes associated with the connection.

KmsKeyId.documentation: An DMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the connection parameters for the endpoint. If you don't specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.

Port.documentation: The port used to access the endpoint.

ServerName.documentation: The name of the server where the endpoint database resides.

SslMode.documentation: The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default is none.

Username.documentation: The user name to be used to log in to the endpoint database.

AwsDmsEndpointDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Database Migration Service (DMS) endpoint. An endpoint provides connection, data store type, and location information about your data store.

AllocatedStorage.documentation: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.documentation: Indicates whether minor engine upgrades are applied automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance window.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone that the replication instance is created in. The default value is a random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the endpoint's Amazon Web Services Region, such as us-east-1d.

EngineVersion.documentation: The engine version number of the replication instance. If an engine version number is not specified when a replication instance is created, the default is the latest engine version available.

KmsKeyId.documentation: An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the data on the replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, DMS uses your default encryption key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.

MultiAZ.documentation: Specifies whether the replication instance is deployed across multiple Availability Zones (AZs). You can't set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the MultiAZ parameter is set to true.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.documentation: The maintenance window times for the replication instance. Upgrades to the replication instance are performed during this time.

PubliclyAccessible.documentation: Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A value of true represents an instance with a public IP address. A value of false represents an instance with a private IP address. The default value is true.

ReplicationInstanceClass.documentation: The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the specified replication instance class.

ReplicationSubnetGroup.documentation: The subnet group for the replication instance.

VpcSecurityGroups.documentation: The virtual private cloud (VPC) security group for the replication instance.

AwsDmsReplicationInstanceDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Database Migration Service (DMS) replication instance. DMS uses a replication instance to connect to your source data store, read the source data, and format the data for consumption by the target data store.

ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.documentation: The identifier of the replication subnet group.

AwsDmsReplicationInstanceReplicationSubn.documentation: Provides details about the replication subnet group.

VpcSecurityGroupId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC security group that’s associated with the replication instance.

AwsDmsReplicationInstanceVpcSecurityGrou.documentation: Provides details about the virtual private cloud (VPC) security group that’s associated with the replication instance.

CdcStartPosition.documentation: Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to start. CCdcStartPosition or CCdcStartTime specifies when you want a CDC operation to start. Only a value for one of these fields is included.

CdcStartTime.documentation: Indicates the start time for a CDC operation. CdcStartPosition or CCdcStartTime specifies when you want a CDC operation to start. Only a value for one of these fields is included.

CdcStopPosition.documentation: Indicates when you want a CDC operation to stop. The value can be either server time or commit time.

Id.documentation: The identifier of the replication task.

ResourceIdentifier.documentation: A display name for the resource identifier at the end of the EndpointArn response parameter. If you don't specify a ResourceIdentifier value, DMS generates a default identifier value for the end of EndpointArn.

ReplicationInstanceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a replication instance.

ReplicationTaskIdentifier.documentation: The user-defined replication task identifier or name.

ReplicationTaskSettings.documentation: The settings for the replication task.

SourceEndpointArn.documentation: The ARN of the source endpoint.

TableMappings.documentation: The table mappings for the replication task, in JSON format.

TargetEndpointArn.documentation: The ARN of the target endpoint.

TaskData.documentation: Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data for certain source and target endpoints.

AwsDmsReplicationTaskDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Database Migration Service (DMS) replication task. A replication task moves a set of data from the source endpoint to the target endpoint.

AwsDynamoDbTableAttributeDefinition.documentation: Contains a definition of an attribute for the table.

BillingMode.documentation: The method used to charge for read and write throughput and to manage capacity.

LastUpdateToPayPerRequestDateTime.documentation:
If the billing mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST, indicates when the billing mode was set to that value.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsDynamoDbTableBillingModeSummary.documentation: Provides information about the billing for read/write capacity on the table.

AttributeDefinitions.documentation: A list of attribute definitions for the table.

BillingModeSummary.documentation: Information about the billing for read/write capacity on the table.

CreationDateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the table was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

GlobalSecondaryIndexes.documentation: List of global secondary indexes for the table.

GlobalTableVersion.documentation: The version of global tables being used.

ItemCount.documentation: The number of items in the table.

KeySchema.documentation: The primary key structure for the table.

LatestStreamArn.documentation: The ARN of the latest stream for the table.

LatestStreamLabel.documentation: The label of the latest stream. The label is not a unique identifier.

LocalSecondaryIndexes.documentation: The list of local secondary indexes for the table.

ProvisionedThroughput.documentation: Information about the provisioned throughput for the table.

Replicas.documentation: The list of replicas of this table.

RestoreSummary.documentation: Information about the restore for the table.

SseDescription.documentation: Information about the server-side encryption for the table.

StreamSpecification.documentation: The current DynamoDB Streams configuration for the table.

TableSizeBytes.documentation: The total size of the table in bytes.

TableStatus.documentation:
The current status of the table. Valid values are as follows:

  • ACTIVE

  • ARCHIVED

  • ARCHIVING

  • CREATING

  • DELETING

  • INACCESSIBLE_ENCRYPTION_CREDENTIALS

  • UPDATING

DeletionProtectionEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether deletion protection is to be enabled (true) or disabled (false) on the table.

IndexSizeBytes.documentation: The total size in bytes of the index.

ItemCount.documentation: The number of items in the index.

Projection.documentation: Attributes that are copied from the table into an index.

ProvisionedThroughput.documentation: Information about the provisioned throughput settings for the indexes.

AwsDynamoDbTableGlobalSecondaryIndex.documentation: Information abut a global secondary index for the table.

AttributeName.documentation: The name of the key schema attribute.

KeyType.documentation: The type of key used for the key schema attribute. Valid values are HASH or RANGE.

AwsDynamoDbTableKeySchema.documentation: A component of the key schema for the DynamoDB table, a global secondary index, or a local secondary index.

KeySchema.documentation: The complete key schema for the index.

Projection.documentation: Attributes that are copied from the table into the index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected.

AwsDynamoDbTableLocalSecondaryIndex.documentation: Information about a local secondary index for a DynamoDB table.

NonKeyAttributes.documentation: The nonkey attributes that are projected into the index. For each attribute, provide the attribute name.

ProjectionType.documentation:
The types of attributes that are projected into the index. Valid values are as follows:

  • ALL

  • INCLUDE

  • KEYS_ONLY

AwsDynamoDbTableProjection.documentation: For global and local secondary indexes, identifies the attributes that are copied from the table into the index.

LastDecreaseDateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the provisioned throughput was last decreased.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

LastIncreaseDateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the provisioned throughput was last increased.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

NumberOfDecreasesToday.documentation: The number of times during the current UTC calendar day that the provisioned throughput was decreased.

ReadCapacityUnits.documentation: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

WriteCapacityUnits.documentation: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

AwsDynamoDbTableProvisionedThroughput.documentation: Information about the provisioned throughput for the table or for a global secondary index.

ReadCapacityUnits.documentation: The read capacity units for the replica.

GlobalSecondaryIndexes.documentation: List of global secondary indexes for the replica.

KmsMasterKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS key that will be used for KMS encryption for the replica.

RegionName.documentation: The name of the Region where the replica is located.

ReplicaStatus.documentation:
The current status of the replica. Valid values are as follows:

  • ACTIVE

  • CREATING

  • CREATION_FAILED

  • DELETING

  • UPDATING

AwsDynamoDbTableReplica.documentation: Information about a replica of a DynamoDB table.

ProvisionedThroughputOverride.documentation: Replica-specific configuration for the provisioned throughput for the index.

AwsDynamoDbTableReplicaGlobalSecondaryIn.documentation: Information about a global secondary index for a DynamoDB table replica.

SourceBackupArn.documentation: The ARN of the source backup from which the table was restored.

SourceTableArn.documentation: The ARN of the source table for the backup.

RestoreDateTime.documentation:
Indicates the point in time that the table was restored to.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

RestoreInProgress.documentation: Whether a restore is currently in progress.

AwsDynamoDbTableRestoreSummary.documentation: Information about the restore for the table.

InaccessibleEncryptionDateTime.documentation:
If the key is inaccessible, the date and time when DynamoDB detected that the key was inaccessible.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Status.documentation: The status of the server-side encryption.

KmsMasterKeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that is used for the KMS encryption.

AwsDynamoDbTableSseDescription.documentation: Information about the server-side encryption for the table.

StreamEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether DynamoDB Streams is enabled on the table.

StreamViewType.documentation: Determines the information that is written to the table.

AwsDynamoDbTableStreamSpecification.documentation: The current DynamoDB Streams configuration for the table.

DirectoryId.documentation: The ID of the Active Directory used for authentication.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointAuthenticationOpt.documentation: Provides details about an Active Directory that’s used to authenticate an Client VPN endpoint.

Type.documentation: The authentication type used.

ActiveDirectory.documentation: Information about the Active Directory, if applicable. With Active Directory authentication, clients are authenticated against existing Active Directory groups.

MutualAuthentication.documentation: Information about the authentication certificates, if applicable.

FederatedAuthentication.documentation: Information about the IAM SAML identity provider, if applicable.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointAuthenticationOpt.documentation: Information about the authentication method used by the Client VPN endpoint.

SamlProviderArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM SAML identity provider.

SelfServiceSamlProviderArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM SAML identity provider for the self-service portal.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointAuthenticationOpt.documentation: Describes the IAM SAML identity providers used for federated authentication.

ClientRootCertificateChain.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the client certificate.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointAuthenticationOpt.documentation: Information about the client certificate used for authentication.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether client connect options are enabled.

LambdaFunctionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function used for connection authorization.

Status.documentation: The status of any updates to the client connect options.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointClientConnectOpti.documentation: The options for managing connection authorization for new client connections.
Describes the status of the Client VPN endpoint attribute.

Enabled.documentation: Current state of text banner feature.

BannerText.documentation: Customizable text that will be displayed in a banner on Amazon Web Services provided clients when a VPN session is established.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointClientLoginBanner.documentation: Options for enabling a customizable text banner that will be displayed on Amazon Web Services provided clients when a VPN session is established.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether client connection logging is enabled for the Client VPN endpoint.

CloudwatchLogGroup.documentation: The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group to which connection logging data is published.

CloudwatchLogStream.documentation: The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log stream to which connection logging data is published.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointConnectionLogOpti.documentation: Information about the client connection logging options for the Client VPN endpoint.

ClientVpnEndpointId.documentation: The ID of the Client VPN endpoint.

Description.documentation: A brief description of the endpoint.

ClientCidrBlock.documentation: The IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation, from which client IP addresses are assigned.

DnsServer.documentation: Information about the DNS servers to be used for DNS resolution.

SplitTunnel.documentation: Indicates whether split-tunnel is enabled in the Client VPN endpoint.

TransportProtocol.documentation: The transport protocol used by the Client VPN endpoint.

VpnPort.documentation: The port number for the Client VPN endpoint.

ServerCertificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.

AuthenticationOptions.documentation: Information about the authentication method used by the Client VPN endpoint.

ConnectionLogOptions.documentation: Information about the client connection logging options for the Client VPN endpoint.

SecurityGroupIdSet.documentation: The IDs of the security groups for the target network.

SelfServicePortalUrl.documentation: The URL of the self-service portal.

ClientConnectOptions.documentation: The options for managing connection authorization for new client connections.

SessionTimeoutHours.documentation: The maximum VPN session duration time in hours.

ClientLoginBannerOptions.documentation: Options for enabling a customizable text banner that will be displayed on Amazon Web Services provided clients when a VPN session is established.

AwsEc2ClientVpnEndpointDetails.documentation: Describes an Client VPN endpoint. A Client VPN endpoint is the resource that you create and configure to enable and manage client VPN sessions. It's the termination point for all client VPN sessions.

PublicIp.documentation: A public IP address that is associated with the EC2 instance.

AllocationId.documentation: The identifier that Amazon Web Services assigns to represent the allocation of the Elastic IP address for use with Amazon VPC.

AssociationId.documentation: The identifier that represents the association of the Elastic IP address with an EC2 instance.

Domain.documentation:
The domain in which to allocate the address.

If the address is for use with EC2 instances in a VPC, then Domain is vpc. Otherwise, Domain is standard.

PublicIpv4Pool.documentation: The identifier of an IP address pool. This parameter allows Amazon EC2 to select an IP address from the address pool.

NetworkBorderGroup.documentation: The name of the location from which the Elastic IP address is advertised.

NetworkInterfaceOwnerId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the network interface.

PrivateIpAddress.documentation: The private IP address that is associated with the Elastic IP address.

Type.documentation: The instance type of the instance.

ImageId.documentation: The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) ID of the instance.

IpV4Addresses.documentation: The IPv4 addresses associated with the instance.

IpV6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses associated with the instance.

KeyName.documentation: The key name associated with the instance.

IamInstanceProfileArn.documentation: The IAM profile ARN of the instance.

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the instance was launched in.

SubnetId.documentation: The identifier of the subnet that the instance was launched in.

LaunchedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the instance was launched.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

NetworkInterfaces.documentation: The identifiers of the network interfaces for the EC2 instance. The details for each network interface are in a corresponding AwsEc2NetworkInterfacesDetails object.

VirtualizationType.documentation: The virtualization type of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) required to launch the instance.

MetadataOptions.documentation: Details about the metadata options for the Amazon EC2 instance.

Monitoring.documentation: Describes the type of monitoring that’s turned on for an instance.

AwsEc2InstanceDetails.documentation: The details of an Amazon EC2 instance.

HttpEndpoint.documentation: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on the instance.

HttpProtocolIpv6.documentation: Enables or disables the IPv6 endpoint for the instance metadata service.

HttpPutResponseHopLimit.documentation: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel.

HttpTokens.documentation: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests.

InstanceMetadataTags.documentation: Specifies whether to allow access to instance tags from the instance metadata.

AwsEc2InstanceMetadataOptions.documentation: Metadata options that allow you to configure and secure the Amazon EC2 instance.

State.documentation: Indicates whether detailed monitoring is turned on. Otherwise, basic monitoring is turned on.

AwsEc2InstanceMonitoringDetails.documentation: The type of monitoring that’s turned on for an Amazon EC2 instance.

NetworkInterfaceId.documentation: The identifier of the network interface. The details are in a corresponding AwsEc2NetworkInterfacesDetails object.

AwsEc2InstanceNetworkInterfacesDetails.documentation: Identifies a network interface for the Amazon EC2 instance.

Ebs.documentation: Parameters used to automatically set up Amazon EBS volumes when the instance is launched.

NoDevice.documentation: Omits the device from the block device mapping when an empty string is specified.

VirtualName.documentation: The virtual device name (ephemeralN). Instance store volumes are numbered starting from 0. An instance type with 2 available instance store volumes can specify mappings for ephemeral0 and ephemeral1. The number of available instance store volumes depends on the instance type.

AwsEc2LaunchTemplateDataBlockDeviceMappi.documentation: Information about a block device mapping for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) launch template.

DeleteOnTermination.documentation: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

Encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the EBS volume is encrypted. Encrypted volumes can only be attached to instances that support Amazon EBS encryption. If you're creating a volume from a snapshot, you can't specify an encryption value.

Iops.documentation: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS).

KmsKeyId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the symmetric Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed key used for encryption.

SnapshotId.documentation: The ID of the EBS snapshot.

Throughput.documentation: The throughput to provision for a gp3 volume, with a maximum of 1,000 MiB/s.

VolumeSize.documentation: The size of the volume, in GiBs. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume size.

AwsEc2LaunchTemplateDataBlockDeviceMappi.documentation: Parameters for a block device for an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume in an Amazon EC2 launch template.

CapacityReservationId.documentation: The ID of the Capacity Reservation in which to run the instance.

CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the instance.

AwsEc2LaunchTemplateDataCapacityReservat.documentation: Information about the target Capacity Reservation or Capacity Reservation group in which to run an Amazon EC2 instance.

CapacityReservationPreference.documentation: Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. If equal to open, the instance can run in any open Capacity Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform, Availability Zone). If equal to none, the instance avoids running in a Capacity Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs in On-Demand capacity.

AwsEc2LaunchTemplateDataCapacityReservat.documentation: Specifies the Capacity Reservation targeting option of an Amazon EC2 instance.

CoreCount.documentation: The number of CPU cores for the instance.

ThreadsPerCore.documentation: The number of threads per CPU core. A value of 1 disables multithreading for the instance, The default value is 2.

AwsEc2LaunchTemplateDataCpuOptionsDetail.documentation: Specifies the CPU options for an Amazon EC2 instance. For more information, see Optimize CPU options in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

CpuCredits.documentation: The credit option for CPU usage of a T instance.
