AccessPolicies.documentation: IAM policy document specifying the access policies for the new Elasticsearch domain.

DomainName.documentation:
Name of an Elasticsearch domain.

Domain names are unique across all domains owned by the same account within an Amazon Web Services Region.

Domain names must start with a lowercase letter and must be between 3 and 28 characters.

Valid characters are a-z (lowercase only), 0-9, and – (hyphen).

Endpoint.documentation:
Domain-specific endpoint used to submit index, search, and data upload requests to an Elasticsearch domain.

The endpoint is a service URL.

Endpoints.documentation: The key-value pair that exists if the Elasticsearch domain uses VPC endpoints.

EncryptionAtRestOptions.documentation: Details about the configuration for encryption at rest.

LogPublishingOptions.documentation: Configures the CloudWatch Logs to publish for the Elasticsearch domain.

NodeToNodeEncryptionOptions.documentation: Details about the configuration for node-to-node encryption.

ServiceSoftwareOptions.documentation: Information about the status of a domain relative to the latest service software.

VPCOptions.documentation: Information that OpenSearch derives based on VPCOptions for the domain.

EnforceHTTPS.documentation: Whether to require that all traffic to the domain arrive over HTTPS.

TLSSecurityPolicy.documentation:
The TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the OpenSearch domain.

Valid values:

  • Policy-Min-TLS-1-0-2019-07, which supports TLSv1.0 and higher

  • Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-2019-07, which only supports TLSv1.2

AwsElasticsearchDomainDomainEndpointOpti.documentation: Additional options for the domain endpoint, such as whether to require HTTPS for all traffic.

DedicatedMasterCount.documentation: The number of instances to use for the master node. If this attribute is specified, then DedicatedMasterEnabled must be true.

DedicatedMasterEnabled.documentation: Whether to use a dedicated master node for the Elasticsearch domain. A dedicated master node performs cluster management tasks, but doesn't hold data or respond to data upload requests.

DedicatedMasterType.documentation:
The hardware configuration of the computer that hosts the dedicated master node. A sample value is m3.medium.elasticsearch. If this attribute is specified, then DedicatedMasterEnabled must be true.

For a list of valid values, see Supported instance types in Amazon OpenSearch Service in the Amazon OpenSearch Service Developer Guide.

InstanceCount.documentation: The number of data nodes to use in the Elasticsearch domain.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type for your data nodes. For example, m3.medium.elasticsearch.

For a list of valid values, see Supported instance types in Amazon OpenSearch Service in the Amazon OpenSearch Service Developer Guide.

ZoneAwarenessConfig.documentation: Configuration options for zone awareness. Provided if ZoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

ZoneAwarenessEnabled.documentation: Whether to enable zone awareness for the Elasticsearch domain. When zone awareness is enabled, OpenSearch allocates the cluster's nodes and replica index shards across Availability Zones in the same Region. This prevents data loss and minimizes downtime if a node or data center fails.

AwsElasticsearchDomainElasticsearchClust.documentation: details about the configuration of an OpenSearch cluster.

AvailabilityZoneCount.documentation: he number of Availability Zones that the domain uses. Valid values are 2 and 3. The default is 2.

Enabled.documentation: Whether encryption at rest is enabled.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The KMS key ID. Takes the form 1a2a3a4-1a2a-3a4a-5a6a-1a2a3a4a5a6a.

AwsElasticsearchDomainEncryptionAtRestOp.documentation: Details about the configuration for encryption at rest.

SearchSlowLogs.documentation: Configures the OpenSearch search slow log publishing.

AwsElasticsearchDomainLogPublishingOptio.documentation: configures the CloudWatch Logs to publish for the Elasticsearch domain.

CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the CloudWatch Logs group to publish the logs to.

Enabled.documentation: Whether the log publishing is enabled.
Whether node-to-node encryption is enabled.

AwsElasticsearchDomainNodeToNodeEncrypti.documentation: Details about the configuration for node-to-node encryption.

AutomatedUpdateDate.documentation: The epoch time when the deployment window closes for required updates. After this time, Amazon OpenSearch Service schedules the software upgrade automatically.

Cancellable.documentation: Whether a request to update the domain can be canceled.

CurrentVersion.documentation: The version of the service software that is currently installed on the domain.

Description.documentation: A more detailed description of the service software status.

NewVersion.documentation: The most recent version of the service software.

UpdateAvailable.documentation: Whether a service software update is available for the domain.

UpdateStatus.documentation:
The status of the service software update. Valid values are as follows:

  • COMPLETED

  • ELIGIBLE

  • IN_PROGRESS

  • NOT_ELIGIBLE

  • PENDING_UPDATE

AwsElasticsearchDomainServiceSoftwareOpt.documentation: Information about the state of the domain relative to the latest service software.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The list of Availability Zones associated with the VPC subnets.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The list of security group IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.

SubnetIds.documentation: A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.

AwsElasticsearchDomainVPCOptions.documentation: Information that OpenSearch derives based on VPCOptions for the domain.

CookieName.documentation: The name of the application cookie used for stickiness.

PolicyName.documentation: The mnemonic name for the policy being created. The name must be unique within the set of policies for the load balancer.

AwsElbAppCookieStickinessPolicy.documentation: Contains information about a stickiness policy that was created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.

CookieExpirationPeriod.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, after which the cookie is considered stale. If an expiration period is not specified, the stickiness session lasts for the duration of the browser session.

PolicyName.documentation: The name of the policy. The name must be unique within the set of policies for the load balancer.

AwsElbLbCookieStickinessPolicy.documentation: Contains information about a stickiness policy that was created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.

EmitInterval.documentation:
The interval in minutes for publishing the access logs.

You can publish access logs either every 5 minutes or every 60 minutes.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.

S3BucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.

S3BucketPrefix.documentation:
The logical hierarchy that was created for the S3 bucket.

If a prefix is not provided, the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.

AwsElbLoadBalancerAccessLog.documentation: Contains information about the access log configuration for the load balancer.

AwsElbLoadBalancerAdditionalAttribute.documentation: Provides information about additional attributes for the load balancer.

AccessLog.documentation:
Information about the access log configuration for the load balancer.

If the access log is enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information about all requests. It delivers the information to a specified S3 bucket.

ConnectionDraining.documentation:
Information about the connection draining configuration for the load balancer.

If connection draining is enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete before it shifts traffic away from a deregistered or unhealthy instance.

ConnectionSettings.documentation:
Connection settings for the load balancer.

If an idle timeout is configured, the load balancer allows connections to remain idle for the specified duration. When a connection is idle, no data is sent over the connection.

CrossZoneLoadBalancing.documentation:
Cross-zone load balancing settings for the load balancer.

If cross-zone load balancing is enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across all instances regardless of the Availability Zones.

AdditionalAttributes.documentation: Any additional attributes for a load balancer.

InstancePort.documentation: The port on which the EC2 instance is listening.

PolicyNames.documentation: The names of the policies that are enabled for the EC2 instance.

AwsElbLoadBalancerBackendServerDescripti.documentation: Provides information about the configuration of an EC2 instance for the load balancer.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether connection draining is enabled for the load balancer.

Timeout.documentation: The maximum time, in seconds, to keep the existing connections open before deregistering the instances.

AwsElbLoadBalancerConnectionDraining.documentation: Contains information about the connection draining configuration for the load balancer.

IdleTimeout.documentation: The time, in seconds, that the connection can be idle (no data is sent over the connection) before it is closed by the load balancer.

AwsElbLoadBalancerConnectionSettings.documentation: Contains connection settings for the load balancer.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether cross-zone load balancing is enabled for the load balancer.

AwsElbLoadBalancerCrossZoneLoadBalancing.documentation: Contains cross-zone load balancing settings for the load balancer.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The list of Availability Zones for the load balancer.

BackendServerDescriptions.documentation: Information about the configuration of the EC2 instances.

CanonicalHostedZoneName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.

CanonicalHostedZoneNameID.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.

CreatedTime.documentation:
Indicates when the load balancer was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

DnsName.documentation: The DNS name of the load balancer.

HealthCheck.documentation: Information about the health checks that are conducted on the load balancer.

Instances.documentation: List of EC2 instances for the load balancer.

ListenerDescriptions.documentation: The policies that are enabled for the load balancer listeners.

Scheme.documentation:
The type of load balancer. Only provided if the load balancer is in a VPC.

If Scheme is internet-facing, the load balancer has a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.

If Scheme is internal, the load balancer has a public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

SecurityGroups.documentation: The security groups for the load balancer. Only provided if the load balancer is in a VPC.

SourceSecurityGroup.documentation: Information about the security group for the load balancer. This is the security group that is used for inbound rules.

Subnets.documentation: The list of subnet identifiers for the load balancer.

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC for the load balancer.

AwsElbLoadBalancerDetails.documentation: Contains details about a Classic Load Balancer.

HealthyThreshold.documentation: The number of consecutive health check successes required before the instance is moved to the Healthy state.

Interval.documentation: The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an individual instance.

Target.documentation:
The instance that is being checked. The target specifies the protocol and port. The available protocols are TCP, SSL, HTTP, and HTTPS. The range of valid ports is 1 through 65535.

For the HTTP and HTTPS protocols, the target also specifies the ping path.

For the TCP protocol, the target is specified as TCP: <port> .

For the SSL protocol, the target is specified as SSL.<port> .

For the HTTP and HTTPS protocols, the target is specified as <protocol>:<port>/<path to ping> .

Timeout.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health check.

UnhealthyThreshold.documentation: The number of consecutive health check failures that must occur before the instance is moved to the Unhealthy state.

AwsElbLoadBalancerHealthCheck.documentation: Contains information about the health checks that are conducted on the load balancer.

AwsElbLoadBalancerInstance.documentation: Provides information about an EC2 instance for a load balancer.

InstancePort.documentation: The port on which the instance is listening.

InstanceProtocol.documentation:
The protocol to use to route traffic to instances.

Valid values: HTTP | HTTPS | TCP | SSL

LoadBalancerPort.documentation:
The port on which the load balancer is listening.

On EC2-VPC, you can specify any port from the range 1-65535.

On EC2-Classic, you can specify any port from the following list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587, 1024-65535.

Protocol.documentation:
The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing.

Valid values: HTTP | HTTPS | TCP | SSL

AwsElbLoadBalancerListenerDescription.documentation: Lists the policies that are enabled for a load balancer listener.

AppCookieStickinessPolicies.documentation: The stickiness policies that are created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.

LbCookieStickinessPolicies.documentation: The stickiness policies that are created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.

OtherPolicies.documentation: The policies other than the stickiness policies.

AwsElbLoadBalancerPolicies.documentation: Contains information about the policies for a load balancer.

AwsElbLoadBalancerSourceSecurityGroup.documentation: Contains information about the security group for the load balancer.

Key.documentation: The name of the load balancer attribute.

Value.documentation: The value of the load balancer attribute.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The Availability Zones for the load balancer.

CanonicalHostedZoneId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone associated with the load balancer.

CreatedTime.documentation:
Indicates when the load balancer was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

DNSName.documentation: The public DNS name of the load balancer.

IpAddressType.documentation: The type of IP addresses used by the subnets for your load balancer. The possible values are ipv4 (for IPv4 addresses) and dualstack (for IPv4 and IPv6 addresses).

Scheme.documentation: The nodes of an Internet-facing load balancer have public IP addresses.

SecurityGroups.documentation: The IDs of the security groups for the load balancer.

Type.documentation: The type of load balancer.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.

Description.documentation: A description of the registry to be created.

RegistryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the registry.

RegistryName.documentation: The name of the schema registry.

AwsEventSchemasRegistryDetails.documentation: A schema defines the structure of events that are sent to Amazon EventBridge. Schema registries are containers for schemas. They collect and organize schemas so that your schemas are in logical groups.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint.

EndpointId.documentation: The URL subdomain of the endpoint. For example, if EndpointUrl is https://abcde.veo.endpoints.event.amazonaws.com, then the EndpointId is abcde.veo.

EventBuses.documentation: The event buses being used by the endpoint.

Name.documentation: The name of the endpoint.

ReplicationConfig.documentation: Whether event replication was enabled or disabled for this endpoint. The default state is ENABLED, which means you must supply a RoleArn. If you don't have a RoleArn or you don't want event replication enabled, set the state to DISABLED.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role used by event replication for the endpoint.

RoutingConfig.documentation: The routing configuration of the endpoint.

State.documentation: The current state of the endpoint.

StateReason.documentation: The reason the endpoint is in its current state.

AwsEventsEndpointDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon EventBridge global endpoint. The endpoint can improve your application’s availability by making it Regional-fault tolerant.

EventBusArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event bus that the endpoint is associated with.

AwsEventsEndpointEventBusesDetails.documentation: Provides details about the Amazon EventBridge event buses that the endpoint is associated with.

AwsEventsEndpointReplicationConfigDetail.documentation: Indicates whether replication is enabled or disabled for the endpoint. If enabled, the endpoint can replicate all events to a secondary Amazon Web Services Region.

FailoverConfig.documentation: The failover configuration for an endpoint. This includes what triggers failover and what happens when it's triggered.

AwsEventsEndpointRoutingConfigDetails.documentation: Provides details about the routing configuration of the endpoint.

Primary.documentation: The main Region of the endpoint.

Secondary.documentation: The Region that events are routed to when failover is triggered or event replication is enabled.

AwsEventsEndpointRoutingConfigFailoverCo.documentation: The failover configuration for an endpoint. This includes what triggers failover and what happens when it's triggered.

HealthCheck.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the health check used by the endpoint to determine whether failover is triggered.

AwsEventsEndpointRoutingConfigFailoverCo.documentation: Provides details about the primary Amazon Web Services Region of the endpoint.
The Amazon Web Services Region that events are routed to when failover is triggered or event replication is enabled.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account permitted to write events to the current account.

Name.documentation: The name of the event bus.

Policy.documentation: The policy that enables the external account to send events to your account.

AwsEventsEventbusDetails.documentation: Provides details about Amazon EventBridge event bus. An event bus is a router that receives events and delivers them to zero or more destinations, or targets. This can be a custom event bus which you can use to receive events from your custom applications and services, or it can be a partner event bus which can be matched to a partner event source.

Status.documentation: Specifies whether CloudTrail is activated as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesCloudTrai.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of CloudTrail as a data source for the detector.

CloudTrail.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of CloudTrail as a data source for the detector.

DnsLogs.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of DNS logs as a data source for the detector.

FlowLogs.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of VPC Flow Logs as a data source for the detector.

Kubernetes.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of Kubernetes data sources for the detector.

MalwareProtection.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of Malware Protection as a data source for the detector.

S3Logs.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of S3 Data event logs as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesDetails.documentation: Describes which data sources are activated for the detector.

Status.documentation: Describes whether DNS logs is enabled as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesDnsLogsDe.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of DNS logs as a data source for the detector.

Status.documentation: Describes whether VPC Flow Logs are activated as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesFlowLogsD.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of VPC Flow Logs as a data source for the detector.

Status.documentation: Describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are activated as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesKubernete.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of Kubernetes audit logs as a data source for the detector.

AuditLogs.documentation: Describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are activated as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesKubernete.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of Kubernetes data sources for the detector.

ScanEc2InstanceWithFindings.documentation: Describes the configuration of Malware Protection for EC2 instances with findings.

ServiceRole.documentation: The GuardDuty Malware Protection service role.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesMalwarePr.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of Malware Protection as a data source for the detector.

EbsVolumes.documentation: Describes the configuration of scanning EBS volumes (Malware Protection) as a data source.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesMalwarePr.documentation: Describes the configuration of Malware Protection for EC2 instances with findings.

Reason.documentation: Specifies the reason why scanning EBS volumes (Malware Protection) isn’t activated as a data source.

Status.documentation: Describes whether scanning EBS volumes is activated as a data source for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesMalwarePr.documentation: Describes the configuration of scanning EBS volumes (Malware Protection) as a data source.

Status.documentation: A value that describes whether S3 data event logs are automatically enabled for new members of an organization.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDataSourcesS3LogsDet.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of S3 data event logs as a data source for the detector.

DataSources.documentation: Describes which data sources are activated for the detector.

Features.documentation: Describes which features are activated for the detector.

FindingPublishingFrequency.documentation: The publishing frequency of the finding.

Status.documentation: The activation status of the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon GuardDuty detector. A detector is an object that represents the GuardDuty service. A detector is required for GuardDuty to become operational.

Name.documentation: Indicates the name of the feature that is activated for the detector.

Status.documentation: Indicates the status of the feature that is activated for the detector.

AwsGuardDutyDetectorFeaturesDetails.documentation: Describes which features are activated for the detector.

UserName.documentation:
The user associated with the IAM access key related to a finding.

The UserName parameter has been replaced with the PrincipalName parameter because access keys can also be assigned to principals that are not IAM users.
UserName.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use PrincipalName.

Status.documentation: The status of the IAM access key related to a finding.

CreatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the IAM access key was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

PrincipalId.documentation: The ID of the principal associated with an access key.

PrincipalType.documentation: The type of principal associated with an access key.

AccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the account for the key.

SessionContext.documentation: Information about the session that the key was used for.

AwsIamAccessKeyDetails.documentation: IAM access key details related to a finding.

Attributes.documentation: Attributes of the session that the key was used for.

SessionIssuer.documentation: Information about the entity that created the session.

AwsIamAccessKeySessionContext.documentation: Provides information about the session that the key was used for.

MfaAuthenticated.documentation: Indicates whether the session used multi-factor authentication (MFA).

CreationDate.documentation:
Indicates when the session was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsIamAccessKeySessionContextAttributes.documentation: Attributes of the session that the key was used for.

Type.documentation: The type of principal (user, role, or group) that created the session.

PrincipalId.documentation: The principal ID of the principal (user, role, or group) that created the session.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the session.

AccountId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that created the session.

UserName.documentation: The name of the principal that created the session.

AwsIamAccessKeySessionContextSessionIssu.documentation: Information about the entity that created the session.

AwsIamAttachedManagedPolicy.documentation: A managed policy that is attached to an IAM principal.

AttachedManagedPolicies.documentation: A list of the managed policies that are attached to the IAM group.

CreateDate.documentation:
Indicates when the IAM group was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

GroupPolicyList.documentation: The list of inline policies that are embedded in the group.

AwsIamGroupPolicy.documentation: A managed policy that is attached to the IAM group.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the instance profile.

CreateDate.documentation:
Indicates when the instance profile was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Roles.documentation: The roles associated with the instance profile.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the role.

AssumeRolePolicyDocument.documentation: The policy that grants an entity permission to assume the role.

CreateDate.documentation:
Indicates when the role was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsIamInstanceProfileRole.documentation: Information about a role associated with an instance profile.

PermissionsBoundaryArn.documentation: The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary.

PermissionsBoundaryType.documentation: The usage type for the permissions boundary.

AwsIamPermissionsBoundary.documentation: Information about the policy used to set the permissions boundary for an IAM principal.

AttachmentCount.documentation: The number of users, groups, and roles that the policy is attached to.

CreateDate.documentation:
When the policy was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

DefaultVersionId.documentation: The identifier of the default version of the policy.

IsAttachable.documentation: Whether the policy can be attached to a user, group, or role.

PermissionsBoundaryUsageCount.documentation: The number of users and roles that use the policy to set the permissions boundary.

UpdateDate.documentation:
When the policy was most recently updated.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

IsDefaultVersion.documentation: Whether the version is the default version.

CreateDate.documentation:
Indicates when the version was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AssumeRolePolicyDocument.documentation: The trust policy that grants permission to assume the role.

AttachedManagedPolicies.documentation: The list of the managed policies that are attached to the role.

CreateDate.documentation:
Indicates when the role was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

InstanceProfileList.documentation: The list of instance profiles that contain this role.

RoleId.documentation: The stable and unique string identifying the role.

RoleName.documentation: The friendly name that identifies the role.

RolePolicyList.documentation: The list of inline policies that are embedded in the role.

MaxSessionDuration.documentation: The maximum session duration (in seconds) that you want to set for the specified role.

AwsIamRoleDetails.documentation: Contains information about an IAM role, including all of the role's policies.

AwsIamRolePolicy.documentation: An inline policy that is embedded in the role.

AttachedManagedPolicies.documentation: A list of the managed policies that are attached to the user.

CreateDate.documentation:
Indicates when the user was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

GroupList.documentation: A list of IAM groups that the user belongs to.

UserPolicyList.documentation: The list of inline policies that are embedded in the user.

AwsIamUserPolicy.documentation: Information about an inline policy that is embedded in the user.

Name.documentation: The name of the Kinesis stream. If you don't specify a name, CloudFront generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the stream name.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis data stream.

StreamEncryption.documentation: When specified, enables or updates server-side encryption using an KMS key for a specified stream. Removing this property from your stack template and updating your stack disables encryption.

ShardCount.documentation: The number of shards that the stream uses.

RetentionPeriodHours.documentation: The number of hours for the data records that are stored in shards to remain accessible.

AwsKinesisStreamDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon Kinesis data stream.

KeyId.documentation: The globally unique identifier for the customer-managed KMS key to use for encryption.

AWSAccountId.documentation: The twelve-digit account ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the KMS key.

CreationDate.documentation:
Indicates when the KMS key was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

KeyId.documentation: The globally unique identifier for the KMS key.

KeyManager.documentation: The manager of the KMS key. KMS keys in your Amazon Web Services account are either customer managed or Amazon Web Services managed.

KeyState.documentation:
The state of the KMS key. Valid values are as follows:

  • Disabled

  • Enabled

  • PendingDeletion

  • PendingImport

  • Unavailable

Origin.documentation:
The source of the KMS key material.

When this value is AWS_KMS, KMS created the key material.

When this value is EXTERNAL, the key material was imported from your existing key management infrastructure or the KMS key lacks key material.

When this value is AWS_CLOUDHSM, the key material was created in the CloudHSM cluster associated with a custom key store.

KeyRotationStatus.documentation: Whether the key has key rotation enabled.

S3Bucket.documentation: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same Amazon Web Services Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different Amazon Web Services account.

S3Key.documentation: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

S3ObjectVersion.documentation: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use.

ZipFile.documentation: The base64-encoded contents of the deployment package. Amazon Web Services SDK and Amazon Web Services CLI clients handle the encoding for you.

AwsLambdaFunctionCode.documentation: The code for the Lambda function. You can specify either an object in Amazon S3, or upload a deployment package directly.

TargetArn.documentation: The ARN of an SQS queue or SNS topic.

AwsLambdaFunctionDeadLetterConfig.documentation: The dead-letter queue for failed asynchronous invocations.

CodeSha256.documentation: The SHA256 hash of the function's deployment package.

Handler.documentation: The function that Lambda calls to begin executing your function.

KmsKeyArn.documentation: The KMS key that is used to encrypt the function's environment variables. This key is only returned if you've configured a customer managed customer managed key.

LastModified.documentation:
Indicates when the function was last updated.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

MasterArn.documentation: For Lambda@Edge functions, the ARN of the master function.

MemorySize.documentation: The memory that is allocated to the function.

RevisionId.documentation: The latest updated revision of the function or alias.

Runtime.documentation: The runtime environment for the Lambda function.

Timeout.documentation: The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it.

Architectures.documentation: The instruction set architecture that the function uses. Valid values are x86_64 or arm64.

PackageType.documentation: The type of deployment package that's used to deploy the function code to Lambda. Set to Image for a container image and Zip for a .zip file archive.

AwsLambdaFunctionEnvironmentError.documentation: Error messages for environment variables that could not be applied.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the function layer.

CodeSize.documentation: The size of the layer archive in bytes.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: A list of VPC security groups IDs.

AwsLambdaFunctionVpcConfig.documentation: The VPC security groups and subnets that are attached to a Lambda function.

CompatibleRuntimes.documentation:
The layer's compatible function runtimes.

The following list includes deprecated runtimes. For more information, see Runtime deprecation policy in the Lambda Developer Guide.

Array Members: Maximum number of 5 items.

Valid Values: nodejs | nodejs4.3 | nodejs6.10 | nodejs8.10 | nodejs10.x | nodejs12.x | nodejs14.x | nodejs16.x | java8 | java8.al2 | java11 | python2.7 | python3.6 | python3.7 | python3.8 | python3.9 | dotnetcore1.0 | dotnetcore2.0 | dotnetcore2.1 | dotnetcore3.1 | dotnet6 | nodejs4.3-edge | go1.x | ruby2.5 | ruby2.7 | provided | provided.al2 | nodejs18.x | python3.10 | java17 | ruby3.2 | python3.11 | nodejs20.x | provided.al2023 | python3.12 | java21

CreatedDate.documentation:
Indicates when the version was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

SourceVolume.documentation: The name of the volume to mount. Must be a volume name referenced in the name parameter of task definition volume.

ContainerPath.documentation: The path on the container to mount the host volume at.

AwsMountPoint.documentation: Details for a volume mount point that's used in a container definition.

Sasl.documentation: Provides details for client authentication using SASL.

Unauthenticated.documentation: Provides details for allowing no client authentication.

Tls.documentation: Provides details for client authentication using TLS.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoClientAuthentica.documentation: Provides details about different modes of client authentication.

Iam.documentation: Provides details for SASL client authentication using IAM.

Scram.documentation: Details for SASL client authentication using SCRAM.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoClientAuthentica.documentation: Provides details for client authentication using SASL.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether SASL/IAM authentication is enabled or not.
Indicates whether SASL/SCRAM authentication is enabled or not.

CertificateAuthorityArnList.documentation: List of Amazon Web Services Private CA Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). Amazon Web Services Private CA enables creation of private certificate authority (CA) hierarchies, including root and subordinate CAs, without the investment and maintenance costs of operating an on-premises CA.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether TLS authentication is enabled or not.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoClientAuthentica.documentation: Provides details for client authentication using TLS.

Enabled.documentation: Indicates whether unauthenticated is allowed or not.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoClientAuthentica.documentation: Provides details for allowing no client authentication.

EncryptionInfo.documentation: Includes encryption-related information, such as the KMS key used for encrypting data at rest and whether you want Amazon MSK to encrypt your data in transit.

CurrentVersion.documentation: The current version of the cluster.

NumberOfBrokerNodes.documentation: The number of broker nodes in the cluster.

ClientAuthentication.documentation: Provides information for different modes of client authentication.

EnhancedMonitoring.documentation: Specifies the level of monitoring for the cluster.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoDetails.documentation: Provide details about an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) cluster.

EncryptionInTransit.documentation: The settings for encrypting data in transit.

EncryptionAtRest.documentation: The data-volume encryption details. You can't update encryption at rest settings for existing clusters.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoEncryptionInfoDe.documentation: Includes encryption-related information, such as the KMS key used for encrypting data at rest and whether you want MSK to encrypt your data in transit.

DataVolumeKMSKeyId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key for encrypting data at rest. If you don't specify a KMS key, MSK creates one for you and uses it.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoEncryptionInfoEn.documentation: The data-volume encryption details. You can't update encryption at rest settings for existing clusters.

InCluster.documentation: When set to true, it indicates that data communication among the broker nodes of the cluster is encrypted. When set to false, the communication happens in plain text. The default value is true.

ClientBroker.documentation: Indicates the encryption setting for data in transit between clients and brokers.

AwsMskClusterClusterInfoEncryptionInfoEn.documentation: The settings for encrypting data in transit.

AwsMskClusterDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) cluster.

DeleteProtection.documentation: Whether the firewall is protected from deletion. If set to true, then the firewall cannot be deleted.

FirewallPolicyChangeProtection.documentation: Whether the firewall is protected from a change to the firewall policy. If set to true, you cannot associate a different policy with the firewall.

SubnetChangeProtection.documentation: Whether the firewall is protected from a change to the subnet associations. If set to true, you cannot map different subnets to the firewall.

SubnetMappings.documentation: The public subnets that Network Firewall uses for the firewall. Each subnet must belong to a different Availability Zone.

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC where the firewall is used.

AwsNetworkFirewallFirewallPolicyDetails.documentation: Details about a firewall policy. A firewall policy defines the behavior of a network firewall.

AwsNetworkFirewallFirewallSubnetMappings.documentation: A public subnet that Network Firewall uses for the firewall.

Capacity.documentation: The maximum number of operating resources that this rule group can use.

RuleGroupName.documentation: The descriptive name of the rule group.

Type.documentation: The type of rule group. A rule group can be stateful or stateless.

AwsNetworkFirewallRuleGroupDetails.documentation:
Details about an Network Firewall rule group. Rule groups are used to inspect and control network traffic. Stateless rule groups apply to individual packets. Stateful rule groups apply to packets in the context of their traffic flow.

Rule groups are referenced in firewall policies.

Enabled.documentation: Enables fine-grained access control.

MasterUserOptions.documentation: Specifies information about the master user of the domain.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainAdvancedSecuri.documentation: Provides information about domain access control options.

InstanceCount.documentation: The number of data nodes to use in the OpenSearch domain.

DedicatedMasterEnabled.documentation: Whether to use a dedicated master node for the OpenSearch domain. A dedicated master node performs cluster management tasks, but does not hold data or respond to data upload requests.

ZoneAwarenessConfig.documentation: Configuration options for zone awareness. Provided if ZoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

DedicatedMasterCount.documentation: The number of instances to use for the master node. If this attribute is specified, then DedicatedMasterEnabled must be true.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type for your data nodes.

For a list of valid values, see Supported instance types in Amazon OpenSearch Service in the Amazon OpenSearch Service Developer Guide.

ZoneAwarenessEnabled.documentation: Whether to enable zone awareness for the OpenSearch domain. When zone awareness is enabled, OpenSearch Service allocates the cluster's nodes and replica index shards across Availability Zones (AZs) in the same Region. This prevents data loss and minimizes downtime if a node or data center fails.

DedicatedMasterType.documentation:
The hardware configuration of the computer that hosts the dedicated master node.

If this attribute is specified, then DedicatedMasterEnabled must be true.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainClusterConfigD.documentation: Details about the configuration of an OpenSearch cluster.

AvailabilityZoneCount.documentation: The number of Availability Zones that the domain uses. Valid values are 2 or 3. The default is 2.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the OpenSearch Service domain.

AccessPolicies.documentation: IAM policy document that specifies the access policies for the OpenSearch Service domain.

Id.documentation: The identifier of the domain.

EncryptionAtRestOptions.documentation: Details about the configuration for encryption at rest.

NodeToNodeEncryptionOptions.documentation: Details about the configuration for node-to-node encryption.

ServiceSoftwareOptions.documentation: Information about the status of a domain relative to the latest service software.

ClusterConfig.documentation: Details about the configuration of an OpenSearch cluster.

VpcOptions.documentation: Information that OpenSearch Service derives based on VPCOptions for the domain.

LogPublishingOptions.documentation: Configures the CloudWatch Logs to publish for the OpenSearch domain.

DomainEndpoints.documentation:
The domain endpoints. Used if the OpenSearch domain resides in a VPC.

This is a map of key-value pairs. The key is always vpc. The value is the endpoint.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainDetails.documentation: Information about an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

CustomEndpointCertificateArn.documentation: The ARN for the security certificate. The certificate is managed in ACM.

CustomEndpointEnabled.documentation: Whether to enable a custom endpoint for the domain.

EnforceHTTPS.documentation: Whether to require that all traffic to the domain arrive over HTTPS.

CustomEndpoint.documentation: The fully qualified URL for the custom endpoint.

TLSSecurityPolicy.documentation: The TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the OpenSearch domain.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainDomainEndpoint.documentation: Information about additional options for the domain endpoint.

Enabled.documentation: Whether encryption at rest is enabled.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainEncryptionAtRe.documentation: Details about the configuration for encryption at rest for the OpenSearch domain.

CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the CloudWatch Logs group to publish the logs to.

Enabled.documentation: Whether the log publishing is enabled.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainLogPublishingO.documentation: Configuration details for a log publishing option.

SearchSlowLogs.documentation: Configures the OpenSearch search slow log publishing.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainLogPublishingO.documentation: Configures the CloudWatch Logs to publish for the OpenSearch domain.

MasterUserArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the master user.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainMasterUserOpti.documentation: Specifies information about the master user of the domain.

Enabled.documentation: Whether node-to-node encryption is enabled.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainNodeToNodeEncr.documentation: Provides details about the configuration for node-to-node encryption.

AutomatedUpdateDate.documentation: The epoch time when the deployment window closes for required updates. After this time, OpenSearch Service schedules the software upgrade automatically.

Cancellable.documentation: Whether a request to update the domain can be canceled.

CurrentVersion.documentation: The version of the service software that is currently installed on the domain.

Description.documentation: A more detailed description of the service software status.

NewVersion.documentation: The most recent version of the service software.

UpdateAvailable.documentation: Whether a service software update is available for the domain.

UpdateStatus.documentation:
The status of the service software update. Valid values are as follows:

  • COMPLETED

  • ELIGIBLE

  • IN_PROGRESS

  • NOT_ELIGIBLE

  • PENDING_UPDATE

OptionalDeployment.documentation: Whether the service software update is optional.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainServiceSoftwar.documentation: Provides information about the state of the domain relative to the latest service software.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The list of security group IDs that are associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.

SubnetIds.documentation: A list of subnet IDs that are associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.

AwsOpenSearchServiceDomainVpcOptionsDeta.documentation: Contains information that OpenSearch Service derives based on the VPCOptions for the domain.

Status.documentation:
The status of the association between the IAM role and the DB cluster. Valid values are as follows:

  • ACTIVE

  • INVALID

  • PENDING

AwsRdsDbClusterAssociatedRole.documentation: An IAM role that is associated with the Amazon RDS DB cluster.

AllocatedStorage.documentation: For all database engines except Aurora, specifies the allocated storage size in gibibytes (GiB).

AvailabilityZones.documentation: A list of Availability Zones (AZs) where instances in the DB cluster can be created.

BackupRetentionPeriod.documentation: The number of days for which automated backups are retained.

Status.documentation: The current status of this DB cluster.

Endpoint.documentation: The connection endpoint for the primary instance of the DB cluster.

ReaderEndpoint.documentation: The reader endpoint for the DB cluster.

CustomEndpoints.documentation: A list of custom endpoints for the DB cluster.

MultiAz.documentation: Whether the DB cluster has instances in multiple Availability Zones.

Engine.documentation:
The name of the database engine to use for this DB cluster. Valid values are as follows:

  • aurora

  • aurora-mysql

  • aurora-postgresql

EngineVersion.documentation: The version number of the database engine to use.

Port.documentation: The port number on which the DB instances in the DB cluster accept connections.

MasterUsername.documentation: The name of the master user for the DB cluster.

PreferredBackupWindow.documentation:
The range of time each day when automated backups are created, if automated backups are enabled.

Uses the format HH:MM-HH:MM. For example, 04:52-05:22.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.documentation:
The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

Uses the format <day>:HH:MM-<day>:HH:MM.

For the day values, use mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|sun.

For example, sun:09:32-sun:10:02.

ReadReplicaIdentifiers.documentation: The identifiers of the read replicas that are associated with this DB cluster.

VpcSecurityGroups.documentation: A list of VPC security groups that the DB cluster belongs to.

HostedZoneId.documentation: Specifies the identifier that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN of the KMS master key that is used to encrypt the database instances in the DB cluster.

DbClusterResourceId.documentation: The identifier of the DB cluster. The identifier must be unique within each Amazon Web Services Region and is immutable.

AssociatedRoles.documentation: A list of the IAM roles that are associated with the DB cluster.

ClusterCreateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the DB cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

EnabledCloudWatchLogsExports.documentation: A list of log types that this DB cluster is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.

EngineMode.documentation:
The database engine mode of the DB cluster.Valid values are as follows:

  • global

  • multimaster

  • parallelquery

  • provisioned

  • serverless

DeletionProtection.documentation: Whether the DB cluster has deletion protection enabled.

HttpEndpointEnabled.documentation: Whether the HTTP endpoint for an Aurora Serverless DB cluster is enabled.

ActivityStreamStatus.documentation:
The status of the database activity stream. Valid values are as follows:

  • started

  • starting

  • stopped

  • stopping

CopyTagsToSnapshot.documentation: Whether tags are copied from the DB cluster to snapshots of the DB cluster.

CrossAccountClone.documentation: Whether the DB cluster is a clone of a DB cluster owned by a different Amazon Web Services account.

DomainMemberships.documentation: The Active Directory domain membership records that are associated with the DB cluster.

DbClusterParameterGroup.documentation: The name of the DB cluster parameter group for the DB cluster.

DbSubnetGroup.documentation: The subnet group that is associated with the DB cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

DbClusterOptionGroupMemberships.documentation: The list of option group memberships for this DB cluster.

DbClusterIdentifier.documentation: The DB cluster identifier that the user assigned to the cluster. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a DB cluster.

DbClusterMembers.documentation: The list of instances that make up the DB cluster.

IamDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled.documentation: Whether the mapping of IAM accounts to database accounts is enabled.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.documentation: Indicates if minor version upgrades are automatically applied to the cluster.

AwsRdsDbClusterDetails.documentation: Information about an Amazon RDS DB cluster.

IsClusterWriter.documentation: Whether the cluster member is the primary instance for the DB cluster.

PromotionTier.documentation: Specifies the order in which an Aurora replica is promoted to the primary instance when the existing primary instance fails.

DbInstanceIdentifier.documentation: The instance identifier for this member of the DB cluster.

DbClusterParameterGroupStatus.documentation: The status of the DB cluster parameter group for this member of the DB cluster.

AwsRdsDbClusterMember.documentation: Information about an instance in the DB cluster.

DbClusterOptionGroupName.documentation: The name of the DB cluster option group.

Status.documentation: The status of the DB cluster option group.

AwsRdsDbClusterOptionGroupMembership.documentation: Information about an option group membership for a DB cluster.

AttributeName.documentation: The name of the manual DB cluster snapshot attribute. The attribute named restore refers to the list of Amazon Web Services accounts that have permission to copy or restore the manual DB cluster snapshot.

AttributeValues.documentation: The value(s) for the manual DB cluster snapshot attribute. If the AttributeName field is set to restore, then this element returns a list of IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts that are authorized to copy or restore the manual DB cluster snapshot. If a value of all is in the list, then the manual DB cluster snapshot is public and available for any Amazon Web Services account to copy or restore.

AwsRdsDbClusterSnapshotDbClusterSnapshot.documentation: Contains the name and values of a manual Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) DB cluster snapshot attribute.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: A list of Availability Zones where instances in the DB cluster can be created.

SnapshotCreateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the snapshot was taken.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Engine.documentation: The name of the database engine that you want to use for this DB instance.

AllocatedStorage.documentation: Specifies the allocated storage size in gibibytes (GiB).

Status.documentation: The status of this DB cluster snapshot.

Port.documentation: The port number on which the DB instances in the DB cluster accept connections.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC ID that is associated with the DB cluster snapshot.

ClusterCreateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the DB cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

MasterUsername.documentation: The name of the master user for the DB cluster.

EngineVersion.documentation: The version of the database engine to use.

LicenseModel.documentation: The license model information for this DB cluster snapshot.

PercentProgress.documentation: Specifies the percentage of the estimated data that has been transferred.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN of the KMS master key that is used to encrypt the database instances in the DB cluster.

DbClusterSnapshotIdentifier.documentation: The identifier of the DB cluster snapshot.

IamDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled.documentation: Whether mapping of IAM accounts to database accounts is enabled.

DbClusterSnapshotAttributes.documentation: Contains the name and values of a manual DB cluster snapshot attribute.

AwsRdsDbClusterSnapshotDetails.documentation: Information about an Amazon RDS DB cluster snapshot.

Domain.documentation: The identifier of the Active Directory domain.

Status.documentation: The status of the Active Directory Domain membership for the DB instance.

Fqdn.documentation: The fully qualified domain name of the Active Directory domain.

IamRoleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to use when making API calls to the Directory Service.

AwsRdsDbDomainMembership.documentation: Information about an Active Directory domain membership record associated with the DB instance.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that is associated with the DB instance.

FeatureName.documentation: The name of the feature associated with the IAM role.

Status.documentation:
Describes the state of the association between the IAM role and the DB instance. The Status property returns one of the following values:

  • ACTIVE - The IAM role ARN is associated with the DB instance and can be used to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.

  • PENDING - The IAM role ARN is being associated with the DB instance.

  • INVALID - The IAM role ARN is associated with the DB instance. But the DB instance is unable to assume the IAM role in order to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.

AwsRdsDbInstanceAssociatedRole.documentation: An IAM role associated with the DB instance.

AssociatedRoles.documentation: The IAM roles associated with the DB instance.

CACertificateIdentifier.documentation: The identifier of the CA certificate for this DB instance.

DBClusterIdentifier.documentation: If the DB instance is a member of a DB cluster, contains the name of the DB cluster that the DB instance is a member of.

DBInstanceIdentifier.documentation: Contains a user-supplied database identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a DB instance.

DBInstanceClass.documentation: Contains the name of the compute and memory capacity class of the DB instance.

DbInstancePort.documentation: Specifies the port that the DB instance listens on. If the DB instance is part of a DB cluster, this can be a different port than the DB cluster port.

DbiResourceId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the DB instance. This identifier is found in CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for the DB instance is accessed.

DBName.documentation:
The meaning of this parameter differs according to the database engine you use.

MySQL, MariaDB, SQL Server, PostgreSQL

Contains the name of the initial database of this instance that was provided at create time, if one was specified when the DB instance was created. This same name is returned for the life of the DB instance.

Oracle

Contains the Oracle System ID (SID) of the created DB instance. Not shown when the returned parameters don't apply to an Oracle DB instance.

DeletionProtection.documentation:
Indicates whether the DB instance has deletion protection enabled.

When deletion protection is enabled, the database cannot be deleted.

Engine.documentation: Provides the name of the database engine to use for this DB instance.

IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled.documentation:
True if mapping of IAM accounts to database accounts is enabled, and otherwise false.

IAM database authentication can be enabled for the following database engines.

  • For MySQL 5.6, minor version 5.6.34 or higher

  • For MySQL 5.7, minor version 5.7.16 or higher

  • Aurora 5.6 or higher

InstanceCreateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the DB instance was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

KmsKeyId.documentation: If StorageEncrypted is true, the KMS key identifier for the encrypted DB instance.

PubliclyAccessible.documentation:
Specifies the accessibility options for the DB instance.

A value of true specifies an Internet-facing instance with a publicly resolvable DNS name, which resolves to a public IP address.

A value of false specifies an internal instance with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

StorageEncrypted.documentation: Specifies whether the DB instance is encrypted.

TdeCredentialArn.documentation: The ARN from the key store with which the instance is associated for TDE encryption.

VpcSecurityGroups.documentation: A list of VPC security groups that the DB instance belongs to.

MultiAz.documentation: Whether the DB instance is a multiple Availability Zone deployment.

EnhancedMonitoringResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the CloudWatch Logs log stream that receives the enhanced monitoring metrics data for the DB instance.

DbInstanceStatus.documentation: The current status of the DB instance.

MasterUsername.documentation: The master user name of the DB instance.

AllocatedStorage.documentation: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to initially allocate for the DB instance.

PreferredBackupWindow.documentation:
The range of time each day when automated backups are created, if automated backups are enabled.

Uses the format HH:MM-HH:MM. For example, 04:52-05:22.

BackupRetentionPeriod.documentation: The number of days for which to retain automated backups.

DbSecurityGroups.documentation: A list of the DB security groups to assign to the DB instance.

DbParameterGroups.documentation: A list of the DB parameter groups to assign to the DB instance.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone where the DB instance will be created.

DbSubnetGroup.documentation: Information about the subnet group that is associated with the DB instance.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.documentation:
The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

Uses the format <day>:HH:MM-<day>:HH:MM.

For the day values, use mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|sun.

For example, sun:09:32-sun:10:02.

PendingModifiedValues.documentation: Changes to the DB instance that are currently pending.

LatestRestorableTime.documentation:
Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.documentation: Indicates whether minor version patches are applied automatically.

ReadReplicaSourceDBInstanceIdentifier.documentation: If this DB instance is a read replica, contains the identifier of the source DB instance.

ReadReplicaDBInstanceIdentifiers.documentation: List of identifiers of the read replicas associated with this DB instance.

ReadReplicaDBClusterIdentifiers.documentation: List of identifiers of Aurora DB clusters to which the RDS DB instance is replicated as a read replica.

LicenseModel.documentation: License model information for this DB instance.

Iops.documentation: Specifies the provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) for this DB instance.

OptionGroupMemberships.documentation: The list of option group memberships for this DB instance.

CharacterSetName.documentation: The name of the character set that this DB instance is associated with.

SecondaryAvailabilityZone.documentation: For a DB instance with multi-Availability Zone support, the name of the secondary Availability Zone.

StatusInfos.documentation: The status of a read replica. If the instance isn't a read replica, this is empty.

StorageType.documentation: The storage type for the DB instance.

DomainMemberships.documentation: The Active Directory domain membership records associated with the DB instance.

CopyTagsToSnapshot.documentation: Whether to copy resource tags to snapshots of the DB instance.

MonitoringInterval.documentation: The interval, in seconds, between points when enhanced monitoring metrics are collected for the DB instance.

MonitoringRoleArn.documentation: The ARN for the IAM role that permits Amazon RDS to send enhanced monitoring metrics to CloudWatch Logs.

PromotionTier.documentation: The order in which to promote an Aurora replica to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.

Timezone.documentation: The time zone of the DB instance.

PerformanceInsightsEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether Performance Insights is enabled for the DB instance.

PerformanceInsightsKmsKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS key used to encrypt the Performance Insights data.

PerformanceInsightsRetentionPeriod.documentation: The number of days to retain Performance Insights data.

EnabledCloudWatchLogsExports.documentation: A list of log types that this DB instance is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.

ProcessorFeatures.documentation: The number of CPU cores and the number of threads per core for the DB instance class of the DB instance.

MaxAllocatedStorage.documentation: The upper limit to which Amazon RDS can automatically scale the storage of the DB instance.

AwsRdsDbInstanceDetails.documentation: Contains the details of an Amazon RDS DB instance.

Address.documentation: Specifies the DNS address of the DB instance.

Port.documentation: Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.

HostedZoneId.documentation: Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

VpcSecurityGroupId.documentation: The name of the VPC security group.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPC security group.

AwsRdsDbInstanceVpcSecurityGroup.documentation: A VPC security groups that the DB instance belongs to.

Status.documentation: The status of the option group membership.

AwsRdsDbParameterGroup.documentation: Provides information about a parameter group for a DB instance.

DbInstanceClass.documentation: The new DB instance class for the DB instance.

AllocatedStorage.documentation: The new value of the allocated storage for the DB instance.

MasterUserPassword.documentation: The new master user password for the DB instance.

Port.documentation: The new port for the DB instance.

BackupRetentionPeriod.documentation: The new backup retention period for the DB instance.

MultiAZ.documentation: Indicates that a single Availability Zone DB instance is changing to a multiple Availability Zone deployment.

EngineVersion.documentation: The new engine version for the DB instance.

LicenseModel.documentation: The new license model value for the DB instance.

Iops.documentation: The new provisioned IOPS value for the DB instance.

DbInstanceIdentifier.documentation: The new DB instance identifier for the DB instance.

StorageType.documentation: The new storage type for the DB instance.

CaCertificateIdentifier.documentation: The new CA certificate identifier for the DB instance.

DbSubnetGroupName.documentation: The name of the new subnet group for the DB instance.

PendingCloudWatchLogsExports.documentation: A list of log types that are being enabled or disabled.

AwsRdsDbPendingModifiedValues.documentation: Changes to a DB instance that are currently pending.

Name.documentation: The name of the processor feature. Valid values are coreCount or threadsPerCore.

DbSecurityGroupArn.documentation: The ARN for the DB security group.

DbSecurityGroupDescription.documentation: Provides the description of the DB security group.

DbSecurityGroupName.documentation: Specifies the name of the DB security group.

Ec2SecurityGroups.documentation: Contains a list of EC2 security groups.

OwnerId.documentation: Provides the Amazon Web Services ID of the owner of a specific DB security group.

VpcId.documentation: Provides VPC ID associated with the DB security group.

AwsRdsDbSecurityGroupDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon RDS DB security group.

Ec2SecurityGroupId.documentation: Specifies the ID for the EC2 security group.

Ec2SecurityGroupName.documentation: Specifies the name of the EC2 security group.

Ec2SecurityGroupOwnerId.documentation: Provides the Amazon Web Services ID of the owner of the EC2 security group.

Status.documentation: Provides the status of the EC2 security group.

AwsRdsDbSecurityGroupEc2SecurityGroup.documentation: EC2 security group information for an RDS DB security group.

Status.documentation: Specifies the status of the IP range.

AwsRdsDbSecurityGroupIpRange.documentation: IP range information for an RDS DB security group.

DbSnapshotIdentifier.documentation: The name or ARN of the DB snapshot that is used to restore the DB instance.

SnapshotCreateTime.documentation: When the snapshot was taken in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Engine.documentation:
The name of the database engine to use for this DB instance. Valid values are as follows:

  • aurora

  • aurora-mysql

  • aurora-postgresql

  • c

  • mariadb

  • mysql

  • oracle-ee

  • oracle-se

  • oracle-se1

  • oracle-se2

  • sqlserver-ee

  • sqlserver-ex

  • sqlserver-se

  • sqlserver-web

AllocatedStorage.documentation: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be initially allocated for the database instance.

Status.documentation: The status of this DB snapshot.

Port.documentation: The port that the database engine was listening on at the time of the snapshot.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: Specifies the name of the Availability Zone in which the DB instance was located at the time of the DB snapshot.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC ID associated with the DB snapshot.

InstanceCreateTime.documentation: Specifies the time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when the DB instance, from which the snapshot was taken, was created.

MasterUsername.documentation: The master user name for the DB snapshot.

LicenseModel.documentation: License model information for the restored DB instance.

Iops.documentation: The provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value of the DB instance at the time of the snapshot.

OptionGroupName.documentation: The option group name for the DB snapshot.

PercentProgress.documentation: The percentage of the estimated data that has been transferred.

SourceRegion.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region that the DB snapshot was created in or copied from.

SourceDbSnapshotIdentifier.documentation: The DB snapshot ARN that the DB snapshot was copied from.

StorageType.documentation:
The storage type associated with the DB snapshot. Valid values are as follows:

  • gp2

  • io1

  • standard

TdeCredentialArn.documentation: The ARN from the key store with which to associate the instance for TDE encryption.

KmsKeyId.documentation: If Encrypted is true, the KMS key identifier for the encrypted DB snapshot.

Timezone.documentation: The time zone of the DB snapshot.

IamDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled.documentation: Whether mapping of IAM accounts to database accounts is enabled.

ProcessorFeatures.documentation: The number of CPU cores and the number of threads per core for the DB instance class of the DB instance.

DbiResourceId.documentation: The identifier for the source DB instance.

AwsRdsDbSnapshotDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon RDS DB cluster snapshot.

StatusType.documentation: The type of status. For a read replica, the status type is read replication.

Normal.documentation: Whether the read replica instance is operating normally.

Status.documentation: The status of the read replica instance.

Message.documentation: If the read replica is currently in an error state, provides the error details.

AwsRdsDbStatusInfo.documentation: Information about the status of a read replica.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC ID of the subnet group.

Subnets.documentation: A list of subnets in the subnet group.

AwsRdsDbSubnetGroup.documentation: Information about the subnet group for the database instance.

SubnetIdentifier.documentation: The identifier of a subnet in the subnet group.

SubnetAvailabilityZone.documentation: Information about the Availability Zone for a subnet in the subnet group.

SubnetStatus.documentation: The status of a subnet in the subnet group.

AwsRdsDbSubnetGroupSubnet.documentation: Information about a subnet in a subnet group.

Name.documentation: The name of the Availability Zone for a subnet in the subnet group.

AwsRdsDbSubnetGroupSubnetAvailabilityZon.documentation: An Availability Zone for a subnet in a subnet group.

CustSubscriptionId.documentation: The identifier of the account that is associated with the event notification subscription.

CustomerAwsId.documentation: The identifier of the event notification subscription.

Enabled.documentation: Whether the event notification subscription is enabled.

EventCategoriesList.documentation: The list of event categories for the event notification subscription.

EventSubscriptionArn.documentation: The ARN of the event notification subscription.

SnsTopicArn.documentation: The ARN of the SNS topic to post the event notifications to.

SourceIdsList.documentation: A list of source identifiers for the event notification subscription.

SourceType.documentation: The source type for the event notification subscription.

Status.documentation:
The status of the event notification subscription.

Valid values: creating | modifying | deleting | active | no-permission | topic-not-exist

SubscriptionCreationTime.documentation:
The datetime when the event notification subscription was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsRdsEventSubscriptionDetails.documentation: Details about an Amazon RDS event notification subscription. The subscription allows Amazon RDS to post events to an SNS topic.

LogTypesToEnable.documentation: A list of log types that are being enabled.

LogTypesToDisable.documentation: A list of log types that are being disabled.

AwsRdsPendingCloudWatchLogsExports.documentation: Identifies the log types to enable and disable.

NodeRole.documentation: The role of the node. A node might be a leader node or a compute node.

PrivateIpAddress.documentation: The private IP address of the node.

PublicIpAddress.documentation: The public IP address of the node.

AwsRedshiftClusterClusterNode.documentation: A node in an Amazon Redshift cluster.

ParameterApplyStatus.documentation: The status of updates to the parameters.

AwsRedshiftClusterClusterParameterGroup.documentation: A cluster parameter group that is associated with an Amazon Redshift cluster.

ParameterApplyStatus.documentation:
The status of the parameter. Indicates whether the parameter is in sync with the database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered an error when it was applied.

Valid values: in-sync | pending-reboot | applying | invalid-parameter | apply-deferred | apply-error | unknown-error

ParameterApplyErrorDescription.documentation: The error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the database.

AwsRedshiftClusterClusterParameterStatus.documentation: The status of a parameter in a cluster parameter group for an Amazon Redshift cluster.

ClusterSecurityGroupName.documentation: The name of the cluster security group.

Status.documentation: The status of the cluster security group.

AwsRedshiftClusterClusterSecurityGroup.documentation: A security group that is associated with the cluster.

DestinationRegion.documentation: The destination Region that snapshots are automatically copied to when cross-Region snapshot copy is enabled.

ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod.documentation:
The number of days that manual snapshots are retained in the destination Region after they are copied from a source Region.

If the value is -1, then the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.

Valid values: Either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653

RetentionPeriod.documentation: The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination Region after they are copied from a source Region.

SnapshotCopyGrantName.documentation: The name of the snapshot copy grant.

AwsRedshiftClusterClusterSnapshotCopySta.documentation: You can configure Amazon Redshift to copy snapshots for a cluster to another Amazon Web Services Region. This parameter provides information about a cross-Region snapshot copy.

DeferMaintenanceEndTime.documentation:
The end of the time window for which maintenance was deferred.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

DeferMaintenanceStartTime.documentation:
The start of the time window for which maintenance was deferred.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsRedshiftClusterDeferredMaintenanceWin.documentation: A time windows during which maintenance was deferred for an Amazon Redshift cluster.

AllowVersionUpgrade.documentation: Indicates whether major version upgrades are applied automatically to the cluster during the maintenance window.

AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod.documentation: The number of days that automatic cluster snapshots are retained.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The name of the Availability Zone in which the cluster is located.

ClusterAvailabilityStatus.documentation:
The availability status of the cluster for queries. Possible values are the following:

  • Available - The cluster is available for queries.

  • Unavailable - The cluster is not available for queries.

  • Maintenance - The cluster is intermittently available for queries due to maintenance activities.

  • Modifying -The cluster is intermittently available for queries due to changes that modify the cluster.

  • Failed - The cluster failed and is not available for queries.

ClusterCreateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the cluster was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ClusterParameterGroups.documentation: The list of cluster parameter groups that are associated with this cluster.

ClusterRevisionNumber.documentation: The specific revision number of the database in the cluster.

ClusterSecurityGroups.documentation: A list of cluster security groups that are associated with the cluster.

ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus.documentation: Information about the destination Region and retention period for the cross-Region snapshot copy.

ClusterStatus.documentation:
The current status of the cluster.

Valid values: available | available, prep-for-resize | available, resize-cleanup | cancelling-resize | creating | deleting | final-snapshot | hardware-failure | incompatible-hsm | incompatible-network | incompatible-parameters | incompatible-restore | modifying | paused | rebooting | renaming | resizing | rotating-keys | storage-full | updating-hsm

ClusterSubnetGroupName.documentation: The name of the subnet group that is associated with the cluster. This parameter is valid only when the cluster is in a VPC.

ClusterVersion.documentation: The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that runs on the cluster.

DBName.documentation:
The name of the initial database that was created when the cluster was created.

The same name is returned for the life of the cluster.

If an initial database is not specified, a database named devdev is created by default.

DeferredMaintenanceWindows.documentation: List of time windows during which maintenance was deferred.

ElasticIpStatus.documentation: Information about the status of the Elastic IP (EIP) address.

ElasticResizeNumberOfNodeOptions.documentation: The number of nodes that you can use the elastic resize method to resize the cluster to.

Encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the data in the cluster is encrypted at rest.

EnhancedVpcRouting.documentation: Indicates whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled.

ExpectedNextSnapshotScheduleTime.documentation:
Indicates when the next snapshot is expected to be taken. The cluster must have a valid snapshot schedule and have backups enabled.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ExpectedNextSnapshotScheduleTimeStatus.documentation:
The status of the next expected snapshot.

Valid values: OnTrack | Pending

HsmStatus.documentation: Information about whether the Amazon Redshift cluster finished applying any changes to hardware security module (HSM) settings that were specified in a modify cluster command.

IamRoles.documentation: A list of IAM roles that the cluster can use to access other Amazon Web Services services.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS encryption key that is used to encrypt data in the cluster.

MaintenanceTrackName.documentation: The name of the maintenance track for the cluster.

ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod.documentation:
The default number of days to retain a manual snapshot.

If the value is -1, the snapshot is retained indefinitely.

This setting doesn't change the retention period of existing snapshots.

Valid values: Either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653

MasterUsername.documentation: The master user name for the cluster. This name is used to connect to the database that is specified in as the value of DBName.

NextMaintenanceWindowStartTime.documentation:
Indicates the start of the next maintenance window.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

NodeType.documentation: The node type for the nodes in the cluster.
