NumberOfNodes.documentation: The number of compute nodes in the cluster.

PendingActions.documentation: A list of cluster operations that are waiting to start.

PendingModifiedValues.documentation: A list of changes to the cluster that are currently pending.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.documentation:
The weekly time range, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), during which system maintenance can occur.

Format: <day>:HH:MM-<day>:HH:MM

For the day values, use mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun

For example, sun:09:32-sun:10:02

PubliclyAccessible.documentation: Whether the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

ResizeInfo.documentation: Information about the resize operation for the cluster.

RestoreStatus.documentation: Information about the status of a cluster restore action. Only applies to a cluster that was created by restoring a snapshot.

SnapshotScheduleIdentifier.documentation: A unique identifier for the cluster snapshot schedule.

SnapshotScheduleState.documentation:
The current state of the cluster snapshot schedule.

Valid values: MODIFYING | ACTIVE | FAILED

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the cluster is in, if the cluster is in a VPC.

VpcSecurityGroups.documentation: The list of VPC security groups that the cluster belongs to, if the cluster is in a VPC.

LoggingStatus.documentation: Information about the logging status of the cluster.

ElasticIp.documentation: The elastic IP address for the cluster.

Status.documentation: The status of the elastic IP address.

AwsRedshiftClusterElasticIpStatus.documentation: The status of the elastic IP (EIP) address for an Amazon Redshift cluster.

Port.documentation: The port that the database engine listens on.

AwsRedshiftClusterEndpoint.documentation: The connection endpoint for an Amazon Redshift cluster.

HsmClientCertificateIdentifier.documentation: The name of the HSM client certificate that the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys that are stored in an HSM.

HsmConfigurationIdentifier.documentation: The name of the HSM configuration that contains the information that the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

Status.documentation:
Indicates whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any HSM settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.

Type: String

Valid values: active | applying

AwsRedshiftClusterHsmStatus.documentation: Information about whether an Amazon Redshift cluster finished applying any hardware changes to security module (HSM) settings that were specified in a modify cluster command.

ApplyStatus.documentation:
The status of the IAM role's association with the cluster.

Valid values: in-sync | adding | removing

AwsRedshiftClusterIamRole.documentation: An IAM role that the cluster can use to access other Amazon Web Services services.

BucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.

LastFailureMessage.documentation: The message indicating that the logs failed to be delivered.

LastFailureTime.documentation:
The last time when logs failed to be delivered.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

LastSuccessfulDeliveryTime.documentation:
The last time that logs were delivered successfully.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

S3KeyPrefix.documentation: Provides the prefix applied to the log file names.

AwsRedshiftClusterLoggingStatus.documentation: Provides information about the logging status of the cluster.

AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the automated snapshot retention period.

ClusterIdentifier.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the identifier for the cluster.

ClusterType.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the cluster type.

ClusterVersion.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the service version.

EnhancedVpcRouting.documentation: Indicates whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled.

MaintenanceTrackName.documentation: The name of the maintenance track that the cluster changes to during the next maintenance window.

MasterUserPassword.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the master user password for the cluster.

NodeType.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the cluster's node type.

NumberOfNodes.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to the number of nodes in the cluster.

PubliclyAccessible.documentation: The pending or in-progress change to whether the cluster can be connected to from the public network.

AwsRedshiftClusterPendingModifiedValues.documentation: Changes to the Amazon Redshift cluster that are currently pending.

AllowCancelResize.documentation: Indicates whether the resize operation can be canceled.

AwsRedshiftClusterResizeInfo.documentation: Information about the resize operation for the cluster.

CurrentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond.documentation:
The number of megabytes per second being transferred from the backup storage. Returns the average rate for a completed backup.

This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.

ElapsedTimeInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time an in-progress restore has been running, or the amount of time it took a completed restore to finish.

This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.

EstimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds.documentation:
The estimate of the time remaining before the restore is complete. Returns 0 for a completed restore.

This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.

ProgressInMegaBytes.documentation:
The number of megabytes that were transferred from snapshot storage.

This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.

SnapshotSizeInMegaBytes.documentation:
The size of the set of snapshot data that was used to restore the cluster.

This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.

Status.documentation:
The status of the restore action.

Valid values: starting | restoring | completed | failed

AwsRedshiftClusterRestoreStatus.documentation: Information about the status of a cluster restore action. It only applies if the cluster was created by restoring a snapshot.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPC security group.

VpcSecurityGroupId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC security group.

AwsRedshiftClusterVpcSecurityGroup.documentation: A VPC security group that the cluster belongs to, if the cluster is in a VPC.

Comment.documentation: Any comments that you include about the hosted zone.

AwsRoute53HostedZoneConfigDetails.documentation: An object that contains an optional comment about your Amazon Route 53 hosted zone.

HostedZone.documentation: An object that contains information about the specified hosted zone.

Vpcs.documentation: An object that contains information about the Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (Amazon VPCs) that are associated with the specified hosted zone.

NameServers.documentation: An object that contains a list of the authoritative name servers for a hosted zone or for a reusable delegation set.

QueryLoggingConfig.documentation: An array that contains one QueryLoggingConfig element for each DNS query logging configuration that is associated with the current Amazon Web Services account.

AwsRoute53HostedZoneDetails.documentation: Provides details about a specified Amazon Route 53 hosted zone, including the four name servers assigned to the hosted zone. A hosted zone represents a collection of records that can be managed together, belonging to a single parent domain name.

Id.documentation: The ID that Route 53 assigns to the hosted zone when you create it.

Name.documentation: The name of the domain. For public hosted zones, this is the name that you have registered with your DNS registrar.

Config.documentation: An object that includes the Comment element.

AwsRoute53HostedZoneObjectDetails.documentation: An object that contains information about an Amazon Route 53 hosted zone.

Id.documentation: The identifier of an Amazon VPC.

Region.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region that an Amazon VPC was created in.

AwsRoute53HostedZoneVpcDetails.documentation: For private hosted zones, this is a complex type that contains information about an Amazon VPC.

CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group that Route 53 is publishing logs to.

AwsRoute53QueryLoggingConfigDetails.documentation: Provides details about a specified Amazon Route 53 configuration for DNS query logging.

AccessPointArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access point.

Alias.documentation: The name or alias of the access point.

Bucket.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket associated with the specified access point.

BucketAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the S3 bucket associated with this access point.

Name.documentation: The name of the specified access point.

NetworkOrigin.documentation: Indicates whether this access point allows access from the public internet.

VpcConfiguration.documentation: Contains the virtual private cloud (VPC) configuration for the specified access point.

AwsS3AccessPointDetails.documentation: Returns configuration information about the specified Amazon S3 access point. S3 access points are named network endpoints that are attached to buckets that you can use to perform S3 object operations.

VpcId.documentation: If this field is specified, this access point will only allow connections from the specified VPC ID.

AwsS3AccessPointVpcConfigurationDetails.documentation: The virtual private cloud (VPC) configuration for an Amazon S3 access point.

BlockPublicAcls.documentation: Indicates whether to reject calls to update an S3 bucket if the calls include a public access control list (ACL).

BlockPublicPolicy.documentation: Indicates whether to reject calls to update the access policy for an S3 bucket or access point if the policy allows public access.

IgnorePublicAcls.documentation: Indicates whether Amazon S3 ignores public ACLs that are associated with an S3 bucket.

RestrictPublicBuckets.documentation: Indicates whether to restrict access to an access point or S3 bucket that has a public policy to only Amazon Web Services service principals and authorized users within the S3 bucket owner's account.

AwsS3AccountPublicAccessBlockDetails.documentation: provides information about the Amazon S3 Public Access Block configuration for accounts.

AwsS3BucketBucketLifecycleConfigurationD.documentation: The lifecycle configuration for the objects in the S3 bucket.

DaysAfterInitiation.documentation: The number of days after which Amazon S3 cancels an incomplete multipart upload.

AwsS3BucketBucketLifecycleConfigurationR.documentation: Information about what Amazon S3 does when a multipart upload is incomplete.

AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload.documentation: How Amazon S3 responds when a multipart upload is incomplete. Specifically, provides a number of days before Amazon S3 cancels the entire upload.

ExpirationDate.documentation:
The date when objects are moved or deleted.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ExpirationInDays.documentation: The length in days of the lifetime for objects that are subject to the rule.

ExpiredObjectDeleteMarker.documentation:
Whether Amazon S3 removes a delete marker that has no noncurrent versions. If set to true, the delete marker is expired. If set to false, the policy takes no action.

If you provide ExpiredObjectDeleteMarker, you cannot provide ExpirationInDays or ExpirationDate.

Filter.documentation: Identifies the objects that a rule applies to.

NoncurrentVersionExpirationInDays.documentation: The number of days that an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform the associated action.

NoncurrentVersionTransitions.documentation: Transition rules that describe when noncurrent objects transition to a specified storage class.

Prefix.documentation: A prefix that identifies one or more objects that the rule applies to.

Status.documentation: The current status of the rule. Indicates whether the rule is currently being applied.

Transitions.documentation: Transition rules that indicate when objects transition to a specified storage class.

AwsS3BucketBucketLifecycleConfigurationR.documentation: Identifies the objects that a rule applies to.

Operands.documentation: The values to use for the filter.

Type.documentation: Whether to use AND or OR to join the operands. Valid values are LifecycleAndOperator or LifecycleOrOperator.

Tag.documentation: A tag that is assigned to matching objects.

Type.documentation: The type of filter value. Valid values are LifecyclePrefixPredicate or LifecycleTagPredicate.

AwsS3BucketBucketLifecycleConfigurationR.documentation: A value to use for the filter.
A tag that is assigned to matching objects.

Days.documentation: The number of days that an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform the associated action.

StorageClass.documentation: The class of storage to change the object to after the object is noncurrent for the specified number of days.

AwsS3BucketBucketLifecycleConfigurationR.documentation: A transition rule that describes when noncurrent objects transition to a specified storage class.

Date.documentation:
A date on which to transition objects to the specified storage class. If you provide Date, you cannot provide Days.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Days.documentation: The number of days after which to transition the object to the specified storage class. If you provide Days, you cannot provide Date.

StorageClass.documentation:
The storage class to transition the object to. Valid values are as follows:

  • DEEP_ARCHIVE

  • GLACIER

  • INTELLIGENT_TIERING

  • ONEZONE_IA

  • STANDARD_IA

AwsS3BucketBucketLifecycleConfigurationR.documentation: A rule for when objects transition to specific storage classes.

IsMfaDeleteEnabled.documentation: Specifies whether MFA delete is currently enabled in the S3 bucket versioning configuration. If the S3 bucket was never configured with MFA delete, then this attribute is not included.

Status.documentation: The versioning status of the S3 bucket. Valid values are Enabled or Suspended.

AwsS3BucketBucketVersioningConfiguration.documentation: Describes the versioning state of an S3 bucket.

OwnerId.documentation: The canonical user ID of the owner of the S3 bucket.

OwnerName.documentation: The display name of the owner of the S3 bucket.

OwnerAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the account that owns the S3 bucket.

CreatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the S3 bucket was created.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration.documentation: The encryption rules that are applied to the S3 bucket.

BucketLifecycleConfiguration.documentation: The lifecycle configuration for objects in the specified bucket.

PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.documentation: Provides information about the Amazon S3 Public Access Block configuration for the S3 bucket.

AccessControlList.documentation: The access control list for the S3 bucket.

BucketLoggingConfiguration.documentation: The logging configuration for the S3 bucket.

BucketWebsiteConfiguration.documentation: The website configuration parameters for the S3 bucket.

BucketNotificationConfiguration.documentation: The notification configuration for the S3 bucket.

BucketVersioningConfiguration.documentation: The versioning state of an S3 bucket.

ObjectLockConfiguration.documentation: Specifies which rule Amazon S3 applies by default to every new object placed in the bucket.

Name.documentation: The name of the bucket.

AwsS3BucketDetails.documentation: The details of an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

DestinationBucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket where log files for the S3 bucket are stored.

LogFilePrefix.documentation: The prefix added to log files for the S3 bucket.

AwsS3BucketLoggingConfiguration.documentation: Information about logging for the S3 bucket

AwsS3BucketNotificationConfiguration.documentation: The notification configuration for the S3 bucket.

Events.documentation: The list of events that trigger a notification.

Filter.documentation: The filters that determine which S3 buckets generate notifications.

Destination.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function, Amazon SQS queue, or Amazon SNS topic that generates the notification.

Type.documentation:
Indicates the type of notification. Notifications can be generated using Lambda functions, Amazon SQS queues, or Amazon SNS topics, with corresponding valid values as follows:

  • LambdaConfiguration

  • QueueConfiguration

  • TopicConfiguration

AwsS3BucketNotificationConfigurationDeta.documentation: Details for an S3 bucket notification configuration.

AwsS3BucketNotificationConfigurationFilt.documentation: Filtering information for the notifications. The filtering is based on Amazon S3 key names.

Name.documentation: Indicates whether the filter is based on the prefix or suffix of the Amazon S3 key.

ObjectLockEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether the bucket has an Object Lock configuration enabled.

Rule.documentation: Specifies the Object Lock rule for the specified object.

AwsS3BucketObjectLockConfiguration.documentation: The container element for S3 Object Lock configuration parameters. In Amazon S3, Object Lock can help prevent objects from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time or indefinitely.

Days.documentation: The number of days that you want to specify for the default retention period.

Mode.documentation: The default Object Lock retention mode you want to apply to new objects placed in the specified bucket.

Years.documentation: The number of years that you want to specify for the default retention period.

AwsS3BucketObjectLockConfigurationRuleDe.documentation: The default S3 Object Lock retention mode and period that you want to apply to new objects placed in the specified Amazon S3 bucket.

DefaultRetention.documentation: The default Object Lock retention mode and period that you want to apply to new objects placed in the specified bucket.

AwsS3BucketObjectLockConfigurationRuleDe.documentation: Specifies the S3 Object Lock rule for the specified object. In Amazon S3, Object Lock can help prevent objects from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time or indefinitely.

SSEAlgorithm.documentation: Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption. Valid values are aws: kms or AES256.

KMSMasterKeyID.documentation: KMS key ID to use for the default encryption.

AwsS3BucketServerSideEncryptionByDefault.documentation: Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects in the bucket.

Rules.documentation: The encryption rules that are applied to the S3 bucket.

AwsS3BucketServerSideEncryptionConfigura.documentation: The encryption configuration for the S3 bucket.

ApplyServerSideEncryptionByDefault.documentation: Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects in the bucket. If a PUT object request doesn't specify any server-side encryption, this default encryption is applied.

AwsS3BucketServerSideEncryptionRule.documentation: An encryption rule to apply to the S3 bucket.

ErrorDocument.documentation: The name of the error document for the website.

IndexDocumentSuffix.documentation: The name of the index document for the website.

RedirectAllRequestsTo.documentation: The redirect behavior for requests to the website.

RoutingRules.documentation: The rules for applying redirects for requests to the website.

Hostname.documentation: The name of the host to redirect requests to.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol to use when redirecting requests. By default, this field uses the same protocol as the original request. Valid values are http or https.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRedirectT.documentation: The redirect behavior for requests to the website.

Condition.documentation: Provides the condition that must be met in order to apply the routing rule.

Redirect.documentation: Provides the rules to redirect the request if the condition in Condition is met.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRoutingRu.documentation: A rule for redirecting requests to the website.

HttpErrorCodeReturnedEquals.documentation: Indicates to redirect the request if the HTTP error code matches this value.

KeyPrefixEquals.documentation: Indicates to redirect the request if the key prefix matches this value.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRoutingRu.documentation: The condition that must be met in order to apply the routing rule.

Hostname.documentation: The host name to use in the redirect request.

HttpRedirectCode.documentation: The HTTP redirect code to use in the response.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol to use to redirect the request. By default, uses the protocol from the original request.

ReplaceKeyPrefixWith.documentation:
The object key prefix to use in the redirect request.

Cannot be provided if ReplaceKeyWith is present.

ReplaceKeyWith.documentation:
The specific object key to use in the redirect request.

Cannot be provided if ReplaceKeyPrefixWith is present.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRoutingRu.documentation: The rules to redirect the request if the condition in Condition is met.

LastModified.documentation:
Indicates when the object was last modified.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ETag.documentation: The opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific version of a resource found at a URL.

ContentType.documentation: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.

ServerSideEncryption.documentation: If the object is stored using server-side encryption, the value of the server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3.

SSEKMSKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS symmetric customer managed key that was used for the object.

AcceleratorTypes.documentation: A list of Amazon Elastic Inference instance types to associate with the notebook instance. Currently, only one instance type can be associated with a notebook instance.

AdditionalCodeRepositories.documentation: An array of up to three Git repositories associated with the notebook instance. These can be either the names of Git repositories stored as resources in your account, or the URL of Git repositories in CodeCommit or in any other Git repository. These repositories are cloned at the same level as the default repository of your notebook instance. For more information, see Associating Git repositories with SageMaker AI notebook instances in the Amazon SageMaker AI Developer Guide.

DefaultCodeRepository.documentation: The Git repository associated with the notebook instance as its default code repository. This can be either the name of a Git repository stored as a resource in your account, or the URL of a Git repository in CodeCommit or in any other Git repository. When you open a notebook instance, it opens in the directory that contains this repository. For more information, see Associating Git repositories with SageMaker AI notebook instances in the Amazon SageMaker AI Developer Guide.

DirectInternetAccess.documentation: Sets whether SageMaker AI provides internet access to the notebook instance. If you set this to Disabled, this notebook instance is able to access resources only in your VPC, and is not be able to connect to SageMaker AI training and endpoint services unless you configure a Network Address Translation (NAT) Gateway in your VPC.

FailureReason.documentation: If status of the instance is Failed, the reason it failed.

InstanceMetadataServiceConfiguration.documentation: Information on the IMDS configuration of the notebook instance.

InstanceType.documentation: The type of machine learning (ML) compute instance to launch for the notebook instance.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Key Management Service (KMS) key that SageMaker AI uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to your notebook instance. The KMS key you provide must be enabled. For information, see Enabling and disabling keys in the Key Management Service Developer Guide.

NetworkInterfaceId.documentation: The network interface ID that SageMaker AI created when the instance was created.

NotebookInstanceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notebook instance.

NotebookInstanceLifecycleConfigName.documentation: The name of a notebook instance lifecycle configuration.

NotebookInstanceName.documentation: The name of the new notebook instance.

NotebookInstanceStatus.documentation: The status of the notebook instance.

PlatformIdentifier.documentation: The platform identifier of the notebook instance runtime environment.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the instance.

RootAccess.documentation: Whether root access is enabled or disabled for users of the notebook instance.

SubnetId.documentation: The ID of the VPC subnet to which you have a connectivity from your ML compute instance.

Url.documentation: The URL that you use to connect to the Jupyter notebook that is running in your notebook instance.

VolumeSizeInGB.documentation: The size, in GB, of the ML storage volume to attach to the notebook instance.

AwsSageMakerNotebookInstanceDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon SageMaker AI notebook instance.

MinimumInstanceMetadataServiceVersion.documentation: Indicates the minimum IMDS version that the notebook instance supports.

AwsSageMakerNotebookInstanceMetadataServ.documentation: Information on the instance metadata service (IMDS) configuration of the notebook instance.

RotationRules.documentation: Defines the rotation schedule for the secret.

RotationOccurredWithinFrequency.documentation: Whether the rotation occurred within the specified rotation frequency.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN, Key ID, or alias of the KMS key used to encrypt the SecretString or SecretBinary values for versions of this secret.

RotationLambdaArn.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function that rotates the secret.

Name.documentation: The name of the secret.

AutomaticallyAfterDays.documentation: The number of days after the previous rotation to rotate the secret.

AwsSecretsManagerSecretRotationRules.documentation: Defines the rotation schedule for the secret.

SchemaVersion.documentation: The schema version that a finding is formatted for. The value is 2018-10-08.

Id.documentation:
The security findings provider-specific identifier for a finding.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 512.

ProductArn.documentation:
The ARN generated by Security Hub that uniquely identifies a product that generates findings. This can be the ARN for a third-party product that is integrated with Security Hub, or the ARN for a custom integration.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 12. Maximum length of 2048.

ProductName.documentation:
The name of the product that generated the finding.

Security Hub populates this attribute automatically for each finding. You cannot update this attribute with BatchImportFindings or BatchUpdateFindings. The exception to this is a custom integration.

When you use the Security Hub console or API to filter findings by product name, you use this attribute.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 128.

CompanyName.documentation:
The name of the company for the product that generated the finding.

Security Hub populates this attribute automatically for each finding. You cannot update this attribute with BatchImportFindings or BatchUpdateFindings. The exception to this is a custom integration.

When you use the Security Hub console or API to filter findings by company name, you use this attribute.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 128.

Region.documentation:
The Region from which the finding was generated.

Security Hub populates this attribute automatically for each finding. You cannot update it using BatchImportFindings or BatchUpdateFindings.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 16.

GeneratorId.documentation:
The identifier for the solution-specific component (a discrete unit of logic) that generated a finding. In various security findings providers' solutions, this generator can be called a rule, a check, a detector, a plugin, or something else.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 512.

AwsAccountId.documentation:
The Amazon Web Services account ID that a finding is generated in.

Length Constraints: 12.

Types.documentation:
One or more finding types in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding.

Valid namespace values are: Software and Configuration Checks | TTPs | Effects | Unusual Behaviors | Sensitive Data Identifications

Array Members: Maximum number of 50 items.

FirstObservedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security findings provider first observed the potential security issue that a finding captured.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

LastObservedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security findings provider most recently observed a change in the resource that is involved in the finding.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

CreatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security findings provider created the potential security issue that a finding captured.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

UpdatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security findings provider last updated the finding record.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

Confidence.documentation:
A finding's confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

Criticality.documentation:
The level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the finding.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

Title.documentation:
A finding's title. Title is a required property.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 256.

Description.documentation:
A finding's description. Description is a required property.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.

Remediation.documentation: A data type that describes the remediation options for a finding.

SourceUrl.documentation: A URL that links to a page about the current finding in the security findings provider's solution.

ProductFields.documentation:
A data type where security findings providers can include additional solution-specific details that aren't part of the defined AwsSecurityFinding format.

Can contain up to 50 key-value pairs. For each key-value pair, the key can contain up to 128 characters, and the value can contain up to 2048 characters.

UserDefinedFields.documentation:
A list of name/value string pairs associated with the finding. These are custom, user-defined fields added to a finding.

Can contain up to 50 key-value pairs. For each key-value pair, the key can contain up to 128 characters, and the value can contain up to 1024 characters.

Malware.documentation:
A list of malware related to a finding.

Array Members: Maximum number of 5 items.

Network.documentation: The details of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkPath.documentation: Provides information about a network path that is relevant to a finding. Each entry under NetworkPath represents a component of that path.

Process.documentation: The details of process-related information about a finding.

Threats.documentation:
Details about the threat detected in a security finding and the file paths that were affected by the threat.

Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 32 items.

ThreatIntelIndicators.documentation:
Threat intelligence details related to a finding.

Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 5 items.

Resources.documentation:
A set of resource data types that describe the resources that the finding refers to.

Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 32 items.

Compliance.documentation: This data type is exclusive to findings that are generated as the result of a check run against a specific rule in a supported security standard, such as CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations. Contains security standard-related finding details.

Workflow.documentation: Provides information about the status of the investigation into a finding.

RelatedFindings.documentation:
A list of related findings.

Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 10 items.

Note.documentation: A user-defined note added to a finding.

Vulnerabilities.documentation: Provides a list of vulnerabilities associated with the findings.

PatchSummary.documentation: Provides an overview of the patch compliance status for an instance against a selected compliance standard.

Action.documentation: Provides details about an action that affects or that was taken on a resource.

FindingProviderFields.documentation: In a BatchImportFindings request, finding providers use FindingProviderFields to provide and update their own values for confidence, criticality, related findings, severity, and types.

Sample.documentation: Indicates whether the finding is a sample finding.

GeneratorDetails.documentation: Provides metadata for the Amazon CodeGuru detector associated with a finding. This field pertains to findings that relate to Lambda functions. Amazon Inspector identifies policy violations and vulnerabilities in Lambda function code based on internal detectors developed in collaboration with Amazon CodeGuru. Security Hub receives those findings.

ProcessedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that indicates when Security Hub received a finding and begins to process it.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

AwsAccountName.documentation:
The name of the Amazon Web Services account from which a finding was generated.

Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 50.

Detection.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon GuardDuty Extended Threat Detection attack sequence. GuardDuty generates an attack sequence finding when multiple events align to a potentially suspicious activity. To receive GuardDuty attack sequence findings in Security Hub, you must have GuardDuty enabled. For more information, see GuardDuty Extended Threat Detection in the Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.

AwsSecurityFinding.documentation:
Provides a consistent format for Security Hub findings. AwsSecurityFinding format allows you to share findings between Amazon Web Services security services and third-party solutions.

A finding is a potential security issue generated either by Amazon Web Services services or by the integrated third-party solutions and standards checks.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN generated by Security Hub that uniquely identifies a third-party company (security findings provider) after this provider's product (solution that generates findings) is registered with Security Hub.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID in which a finding is generated.

Id.documentation: The security findings provider-specific identifier for a finding.

GeneratorId.documentation: The identifier for the solution-specific component (a discrete unit of logic) that generated a finding. In various security findings providers' solutions, this generator can be called a rule, a check, a detector, a plugin, etc.

Region.documentation: The Region from which the finding was generated.

Type.documentation: A finding type in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classifies a finding.

FirstObservedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that indicates when the security findings provider first observed the potential security issue that a finding captured.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

LastObservedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that indicates when the security findings provider most recently observed a change in the resource that is involved in the finding.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

CreatedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that indicates when the security findings provider created the potential security issue that a finding reflects.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

UpdatedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that indicates when the security findings provider last updated the finding record.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

SeverityProduct.documentation: The native severity as defined by the security findings provider's solution that generated the finding.
SeverityProduct.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use FindingProviderSeverityOriginal.

SeverityNormalized.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use SeverityLabel or FindingProviderFieldsSeverityLabel.

Confidence.documentation:
A finding's confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

Criticality.documentation:
The level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the finding.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

RecommendationText.documentation: The recommendation of what to do about the issue described in a finding.

SourceUrl.documentation: A URL that links to a page about the current finding in the security findings provider's solution.

ProductFields.documentation: A data type where security findings providers can include additional solution-specific details that aren't part of the defined AwsSecurityFinding format.

ProductName.documentation: The name of the solution (product) that generates findings.

CompanyName.documentation: The name of the findings provider (company) that owns the solution (product) that generates findings.

UserDefinedFields.documentation: A list of name/value string pairs associated with the finding. These are custom, user-defined fields added to a finding.

MalwareName.documentation: The name of the malware that was observed.

MalwareType.documentation: The type of the malware that was observed.

MalwarePath.documentation: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

MalwareState.documentation: The state of the malware that was observed.

NetworkDirection.documentation: Indicates the direction of network traffic associated with a finding.

NetworkProtocol.documentation: The protocol of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceIpV4.documentation: The source IPv4 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceIpV6.documentation: The source IPv6 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourcePort.documentation: The source port of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceDomain.documentation: The source domain of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceMac.documentation: The source media access control (MAC) address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationIpV4.documentation: The destination IPv4 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationIpV6.documentation: The destination IPv6 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationPort.documentation: The destination port of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationDomain.documentation: The destination domain of network-related information about a finding.

ProcessParentPid.documentation: The parent process ID. This field accepts positive integers between O and 2147483647.

ProcessLaunchedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that identifies when the process was launched.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ProcessTerminatedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that identifies when the process was terminated.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ThreatIntelIndicatorType.documentation: The type of a threat intelligence indicator.

ThreatIntelIndicatorValue.documentation: The value of a threat intelligence indicator.

ThreatIntelIndicatorCategory.documentation: The category of a threat intelligence indicator.

ThreatIntelIndicatorLastObservedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that identifies the last observation of a threat intelligence indicator.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ThreatIntelIndicatorSourceUrl.documentation: The URL for more details from the source of the threat intelligence.

ResourceType.documentation: Specifies the type of the resource that details are provided for.

ResourceId.documentation: The canonical identifier for the given resource type.

ResourcePartition.documentation: The canonical Amazon Web Services partition name that the Region is assigned to.

ResourceRegion.documentation: The canonical Amazon Web Services external Region name where this resource is located.

ResourceTags.documentation: A list of Amazon Web Services tags associated with a resource at the time the finding was processed.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceImageId.documentation: The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) ID of the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceIpV4Addresses.documentation: The IPv4 addresses associated with the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceIpV6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses associated with the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceKeyName.documentation: The key name associated with the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceIamInstanceProfile.documentation: The IAM profile ARN of the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceVpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the instance was launched in.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceSubnetId.documentation: The identifier of the subnet that the instance was launched in.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceLaunchedAt.documentation: The date and time the instance was launched.

ResourceAwsS3BucketOwnerId.documentation: The canonical user ID of the owner of the S3 bucket.

ResourceAwsS3BucketOwnerName.documentation: The display name of the owner of the S3 bucket.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyUserName.documentation: The user associated with the IAM access key related to a finding.
ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyUserName.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyPrincipalName.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyPrincipalName.documentation: The name of the principal that is associated with an IAM access key.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyStatus.documentation: The status of the IAM access key related to a finding.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyCreatedAt.documentation: The creation date/time of the IAM access key related to a finding.

ResourceContainerName.documentation: The name of the container related to a finding.

ResourceContainerImageId.documentation: The identifier of the image related to a finding.

ResourceContainerImageName.documentation: The name of the image related to a finding.

ResourceContainerLaunchedAt.documentation:
A timestamp that identifies when the container was started.

For more information about the validation and formatting of timestamp fields in Security Hub, see Timestamps.

ResourceDetailsOther.documentation: The details of a resource that doesn't have a specific subfield for the resource type defined.

ComplianceStatus.documentation: Exclusive to findings that are generated as the result of a check run against a specific rule in a supported standard, such as CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations. Contains security standard-related finding details.

WorkflowState.documentation:
The workflow state of a finding.

Note that this field is deprecated. To search for a finding based on its workflow status, use WorkflowStatus.

WorkflowStatus.documentation:
The status of the investigation into a finding. Allowed values are the following.

  • NEW - The initial state of a finding, before it is reviewed.

    Security Hub also resets the workflow status from NOTIFIED or RESOLVED to NEW in the following cases:

    • RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

    • Compliance.Status changes from PASSED to either WARNING, FAILED, or NOT_AVAILABLE.

  • NOTIFIED - Indicates that the resource owner has been notified about the security issue. Used when the initial reviewer is not the resource owner, and needs intervention from the resource owner.

    If one of the following occurs, the workflow status is changed automatically from NOTIFIED to NEW:

    • RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

    • Compliance.Status changes from PASSED to FAILED, WARNING, or NOT_AVAILABLE.

  • SUPPRESSED - Indicates that you reviewed the finding and don't believe that any action is needed.

    The workflow status of a SUPPRESSED finding does not change if RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

  • RESOLVED - The finding was reviewed and remediated and is now considered resolved.

    The finding remains RESOLVED unless one of the following occurs:

    • RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

    • Compliance.Status changes from PASSED to FAILED, WARNING, or NOT_AVAILABLE.

    In those cases, the workflow status is automatically reset to NEW.

    For findings from controls, if Compliance.Status is PASSED, then Security Hub automatically sets the workflow status to RESOLVED.

RecordState.documentation: The updated record state for the finding.

RelatedFindingsProductArn.documentation: The ARN of the solution that generated a related finding.

RelatedFindingsId.documentation: The solution-generated identifier for a related finding.

NoteUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp of when the note was updated.

FindingProviderFieldsConfidence.documentation:
The finding provider value for the finding confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

FindingProviderFieldsCriticality.documentation:
The finding provider value for the level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the findings.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

FindingProviderFieldsRelatedFindingsId.documentation: The finding identifier of a related finding that is identified by the finding provider.

FindingProviderFieldsRelatedFindingsProd.documentation: The ARN of the solution that generated a related finding that is identified by the finding provider.

FindingProviderFieldsSeverityLabel.documentation: The finding provider value for the severity label.

FindingProviderFieldsSeverityOriginal.documentation: The finding provider's original value for the severity.

FindingProviderFieldsTypes.documentation:
One or more finding types that the finding provider assigned to the finding. Uses the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding.

Valid namespace values are: Software and Configuration Checks | TTPs | Effects | Unusual Behaviors | Sensitive Data Identifications

Sample.documentation: Indicates whether or not sample findings are included in the filter results.

ComplianceSecurityControlId.documentation: The unique identifier of a control across standards. Values for this field typically consist of an Amazon Web Services service and a number, such as APIGateway.5.

ComplianceAssociatedStandardsId.documentation: The unique identifier of a standard in which a control is enabled. This field consists of the resource portion of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) returned for a standard in the DescribeStandards API response.

VulnerabilitiesExploitAvailable.documentation: Indicates whether a software vulnerability in your environment has a known exploit. You can filter findings by this field only if you use Security Hub and Amazon Inspector.

VulnerabilitiesFixAvailable.documentation: Indicates whether a vulnerability is fixed in a newer version of the affected software packages. You can filter findings by this field only if you use Security Hub and Amazon Inspector.

ComplianceSecurityControlParametersName.documentation: The name of a security control parameter.

ComplianceSecurityControlParametersValue.documentation: The current value of a security control parameter.

AwsAccountName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Web Services account in which a finding is generated.

ResourceApplicationName.documentation: The name of the application that is related to a finding.

ResourceApplicationArn.documentation: The ARN of the application that is related to a finding.

AwsSecurityFindingFilters.documentation:
A collection of filters that are applied to all active findings aggregated by Security Hub.

You can filter by up to ten finding attributes. For each attribute, you can provide up to 20 filter values.

Id.documentation: The identifier of the finding that was specified by the finding provider.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN generated by Security Hub that uniquely identifies a product that generates findings. This can be the ARN for a third-party product that is integrated with Security Hub, or the ARN for a custom integration.

AwsSecurityFindingIdentifier.documentation: Identifies which finding to get the finding history for.

KmsMasterKeyId.documentation: The ID of an Amazon Web Services managed key for Amazon SNS or a customer managed key.

Subscription.documentation: Subscription is an embedded property that describes the subscription endpoints of an Amazon SNS topic.

TopicName.documentation: The name of the Amazon SNS topic.

SqsSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates successful message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon SQS endpoint.

SqsFailureFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon SQS endpoint.

ApplicationSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to a platform application endpoint.

FirehoseSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates successful message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose endpoint.

FirehoseFailureFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose endpoint.

HttpSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates successful message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an HTTP endpoint.

HttpFailureFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an HTTP endpoint.

AwsSnsTopicDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon SNS topic to which notifications can be published.

Endpoint.documentation: The subscription's endpoint (format depends on the protocol).

AwsSnsTopicSubscription.documentation: A wrapper type for the attributes of an Amazon SNS subscription.

KmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds.documentation: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling KMS again.

KmsMasterKeyId.documentation: The ID of an Amazon Web Services managed key for Amazon SQS or a custom KMS key.

DeadLetterTargetArn.documentation: The ARN of the dead-letter queue to which Amazon SQS moves messages after the value of maxReceiveCount is exceeded.

Status.documentation:
The current patch compliance status. Valid values are as follows:

  • COMPLIANT

  • NON_COMPLIANT

  • UNSPECIFIED_DATA

CompliantCriticalCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of CRITICAL.

CompliantHighCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of HIGH.

CompliantMediumCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of MEDIUM.

ExecutionType.documentation: The type of execution that was used determine compliance.

NonCompliantCriticalCount.documentation: For the patch items that are noncompliant, the number of items that have a severity of CRITICAL.

CompliantInformationalCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of INFORMATIONAL.

NonCompliantInformationalCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of INFORMATIONAL.

CompliantUnspecifiedCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of UNSPECIFIED.

NonCompliantLowCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of LOW.

NonCompliantHighCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of HIGH.

CompliantLowCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of LOW.

ComplianceType.documentation: The type of resource for which the compliance was determined. For AwsSsmPatchCompliance, ComplianceType is Patch.

PatchBaselineId.documentation: The identifier of the patch baseline. The patch baseline lists the patches that are approved for installation.

OverallSeverity.documentation:
The highest severity for the patches. Valid values are as follows:

  • CRITICAL

  • HIGH

  • MEDIUM

  • LOW

  • INFORMATIONAL

  • UNSPECIFIED

NonCompliantMediumCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of MEDIUM.

NonCompliantUnspecifiedCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of UNSPECIFIED.

PatchGroup.documentation: The identifier of the patch group for which compliance was determined. A patch group uses tags to group EC2 instances that should have the same patch compliance.

AwsSsmComplianceSummary.documentation: Provides the details about the compliance status for a patch.

ComplianceSummary.documentation: The compliance status details for the patch.

AwsSsmPatch.documentation: Provides details about the compliance for a patch.

Patch.documentation: Information about the status of a patch.

AwsSsmPatchComplianceDetails.documentation: Provides information about the state of a patch on an instance based on the patch baseline that was used to patch the instance.

Label.documentation: A user-defined or an auto-generated string that identifies a Map state. This parameter is present only if the stateMachineArn specified in input is a qualified state machine ARN.

LoggingConfiguration.documentation: Used to set CloudWatch Logs options.

Name.documentation: The name of the state machine.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used when creating this state machine.

StateMachineArn.documentation: The ARN that identifies the state machine.

Status.documentation: The current status of the state machine.

TracingConfiguration.documentation: Specifies whether X-Ray tracing is enabled.

Type.documentation: The type of the state machine (STANDARD or EXPRESS).

AwsStepFunctionStateMachineDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Step Functions state machine, which is a workflow consisting of a series of event- driven steps.

LogGroupArn.documentation: The ARN (ends with :*) of the CloudWatch Logs log group to which you want your logs emitted.

AwsStepFunctionStateMachineLoggingConfig.documentation: An object describing a CloudWatch log group. For more information, see Amazon Web Services::Logs::LogGroup in the CloudFormation User Guide.

CloudWatchLogsLogGroup.documentation: An object describing a CloudWatch Logs log group. For more information, see Amazon Web Services::Logs::LogGroup in the CloudFormation User Guide.

AwsStepFunctionStateMachineLoggingConfig.documentation: An array of objects that describes where your execution history events will be logged.

Destinations.documentation: An array of objects that describes where your execution history events will be logged.

IncludeExecutionData.documentation: Determines whether execution data is included in your log. When set to false, data is excluded.

Level.documentation: Defines which category of execution history events are logged.

AwsStepFunctionStateMachineLoggingConfig.documentation: The LoggingConfiguration data type is used to set CloudWatch Logs options.

Enabled.documentation: When set to true, X-Ray tracing is enabled.

AwsStepFunctionStateMachineTracingConfig.documentation: Specifies whether X-Ray tracing is enabled.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for the rate-based rule.

Name.documentation: The name of the rate-based rule.

RateKey.documentation: The field that WAF uses to determine whether requests are likely arriving from single source and are subject to rate monitoring.

RateLimit.documentation: The maximum number of requests that have an identical value for the field specified in RateKey that are allowed within a five-minute period. If the number of requests exceeds RateLimit and the other predicates specified in the rule are met, WAF triggers the action for the rule.

RuleId.documentation: The unique identifier for the rate-based rule.

MatchPredicates.documentation: The predicates to include in the rate-based rule.

AwsWafRateBasedRuleDetails.documentation: Details about a rate-based rule for global resources. A rate-based rule provides settings to indicate when to allow, block, or count a request. Rate-based rules include the number of requests that arrive over a specified period of time.

Negated.documentation:
If set to true, then the rule actions are performed on requests that match the predicate settings.

If set to false, then the rule actions are performed on all requests except those that match the predicate settings.

Type.documentation:
The type of predicate. Valid values are as follows:

  • ByteMatch

  • GeoMatch

  • IPMatch

  • RegexMatch

  • SizeConstraint

  • SqlInjectionMatch

  • XssMatch

AwsWafRateBasedRuleMatchPredicate.documentation: A match predicate. A predicate might look for characteristics such as specific IP addresses, geographic locations, or sizes.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for the rate-based rule.

Name.documentation: The name of the rate-based rule.

RateKey.documentation: The field that WAF uses to determine whether requests are likely arriving from single source and are subject to rate monitoring.

RateLimit.documentation: The maximum number of requests that have an identical value for the field specified in RateKey that are allowed within a five-minute period. If the number of requests exceeds RateLimit and the other predicates specified in the rule are met, WAF triggers the action for the rule.

RuleId.documentation: The unique identifier for the rate-based rule.

MatchPredicates.documentation: The predicates to include in the rate-based rule.

AwsWafRegionalRateBasedRuleDetails.documentation: contains details about a rate-based rule for Regional resources. A rate-based rule provides settings to indicate when to allow, block, or count a request. Rate-based rules include the number of requests that arrive over a specified period of time.

Negated.documentation:
If set to true, then the rule actions are performed on requests that match the predicate settings.

If set to false, then the rule actions are performed on all requests except those that match the predicate settings.

Type.documentation:
The type of predicate. Valid values are as follows:

  • ByteMatch

  • GeoMatch

  • IPMatch

  • RegexMatch

  • SizeConstraint

  • SqlInjectionMatch

  • XssMatch

AwsWafRegionalRateBasedRuleMatchPredicat.documentation: Details for a match predicate. A predicate might look for characteristics such as specific IP addresses, geographic locations, or sizes.

MetricName.documentation: A name for the metrics for the rule.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the rule.

PredicateList.documentation: Specifies the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

AwsWafRegionalRuleDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF Regional rule. This rule identifies the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

MetricName.documentation: A name for the metrics for this rule group.

Name.documentation: The descriptive name of the rule group.

Rules.documentation: Provides information about the rule statements used to identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

AwsWafRegionalRuleGroupDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF Regional rule group. The rule group is a collection of rules for inspecting and controlling web requests.

Type.documentation: Specifies the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

AwsWafRegionalRuleGroupRulesActionDetail.documentation: Describes the action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Action.documentation: The action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Priority.documentation: If you define more than one rule in a web ACL, WAF evaluates each request against the rules in order based on the value of Priority.

Type.documentation: The type of rule in the rule group.

AwsWafRegionalRuleGroupRulesDetails.documentation: Provides information about the rules attached to a rule group

DataId.documentation: A unique identifier for a predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatchSetId or IPSetId.

Negated.documentation: Specifies if you want WAF to allow, block, or count requests based on the settings in the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, or SizeConstraintSet.

Type.documentation: The type of predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatch or IPSet.

AwsWafRegionalRulePredicateListDetails.documentation: Provides details about the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

DefaultAction.documentation: The action to perform if none of the rules contained in the web ACL match.

MetricName.documentation: A name for the metrics for this web ACL.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the web ACL.

RulesList.documentation: An array that contains the action for each rule in a web ACL, the priority of the rule, and the ID of the rule.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclDetails.documentation: Provides information about the web access control list (web ACL). The web ACL contains the rules that identify the requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

Type.documentation: For actions that are associated with a rule, the action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in a rule.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclRulesListActionDetai.documentation: The action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in the rule, such as allow, block, or count the request.

Action.documentation: The action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in the rule, such as allow, block, or count the request.

OverrideAction.documentation: Overrides the rule evaluation result in the rule group.

Priority.documentation: The order in which WAF evaluates the rules in a web ACL.

RuleId.documentation: The ID of an WAF Regional rule to associate with a web ACL.

Type.documentation: For actions that are associated with a rule, the action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in a rule.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclRulesListDetails.documentation: A combination of ByteMatchSet, IPSet, and/or SqlInjectionMatchSet objects that identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

Type.documentation: Overrides the rule evaluation result in the rule group.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclRulesListOverrideAct.documentation: Provides details about the action to use in the place of the action that results from the rule group evaluation.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for this rule.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the rule.

PredicateList.documentation: Specifies the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

AwsWafRuleDetails.documentation: Provides information about a WAF rule. This rule specifies the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for this rule group.

Name.documentation: The name of the rule group.

Rules.documentation: Provides information about the rules attached to the rule group. These rules identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

AwsWafRuleGroupDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF rule group. A rule group is a collection of rules for inspecting and controlling web requests.

Type.documentation: The action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the rule's statement.

AwsWafRuleGroupRulesActionDetails.documentation: Provides information about what action WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Action.documentation: Provides information about what action WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Priority.documentation: If you define more than one rule in a web ACL, WAF evaluates each request against the rules in order based on the value of Priority.

Type.documentation: The type of rule.

AwsWafRuleGroupRulesDetails.documentation: Provides information about the rules attached to the rule group. These rules identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

DataId.documentation: A unique identifier for a predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatchSetId or IPSetId.

Negated.documentation: Specifies if you want WAF to allow, block, or count requests based on the settings in the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, or SizeConstraintSet.

Type.documentation: The type of predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatch or IPSet.

AwsWafRulePredicateListDetails.documentation: Provides details about the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

Name.documentation: A friendly name or description of the web ACL. You can't change the name of a web ACL after you create it.

DefaultAction.documentation: The action to perform if none of the rules contained in the web ACL match.

Rules.documentation: An array that contains the action for each rule in a web ACL, the priority of the rule, and the ID of the rule.

WebAclId.documentation: A unique identifier for a web ACL.

AwsWafWebAclDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF web access control list (web ACL).

Action.documentation: Specifies the action that CloudFront or WAF takes when a web request matches the conditions in the rule.

ExcludedRules.documentation: Rules to exclude from a rule group.

OverrideAction.documentation:
Use the OverrideAction to test your RuleGroup.

Any rule in a RuleGroup can potentially block a request. If you set the OverrideAction to None, the RuleGroup blocks a request if any individual rule in the RuleGroup matches the request and is configured to block that request.

However, if you first want to test the RuleGroup, set the OverrideAction to Count. The RuleGroup then overrides any block action specified by individual rules contained within the group. Instead of blocking matching requests, those requests are counted.

ActivatedRule|OverrideAction applies only when updating or adding a RuleGroup to a web ACL. In this case you don't use ActivatedRule Action. For all other update requests, ActivatedRule Action is used instead of ActivatedRule OverrideAction.

Priority.documentation: Specifies the order in which the rules in a web ACL are evaluated. Rules with a lower value for Priority are evaluated before rules with a higher value. The value must be a unique integer. If you add multiple rules to a web ACL, the values don't need to be consecutive.

Type.documentation:
The rule type.

Valid values: REGULAR | RATE_BASED | GROUP

The default is REGULAR.

AwsWafWebAclRule.documentation: Details for a rule in an WAF web ACL.

CustomRequestHandling.documentation: Defines custom handling for the web request. For information about customizing web requests and responses, see Customizing web requests and responses in WAF in the WAF Developer Guide..

AwsWafv2ActionAllowDetails.documentation: Specifies that WAF should allow the request and optionally defines additional custom handling for the request.

CustomResponse.documentation: Defines a custom response for the web request. For information, see Customizing web requests and responses in WAF in the WAF Developer Guide..

AwsWafv2ActionBlockDetails.documentation: Specifies that WAF should block the request and optionally defines additional custom handling for the response to the web request.

Name.documentation: The name of the custom header.

Value.documentation: The value of the custom header.

AwsWafv2CustomHttpHeader.documentation: A custom header for custom request and response handling.

InsertHeaders.documentation: The HTTP headers to insert into the request.

AwsWafv2CustomRequestHandlingDetails.documentation: Custom request handling behavior that inserts custom headers into a web request. WAF uses custom request handling when the rule action doesn't block the request.

CustomResponseBodyKey.documentation: References the response body that you want WAF to return to the web request client. You can define a custom response for a rule action or a default web ACL action that is set to block.

ResponseCode.documentation: The HTTP status code to return to the client. For a list of status codes that you can use in your custom responses, see Supported status codes for custom response in the WAF Developer Guide.

ResponseHeaders.documentation: The HTTP headers to use in the response.

AwsWafv2CustomResponseDetails.documentation: A custom response to send to the client. You can define a custom response for rule actions and default web ACL actions that are set to block.

Capacity.documentation: The web ACL capacity units (WCUs) required for this rule group.

Description.documentation: A description of the rule group that helps with identification.

Id.documentation: A unique identifier for the rule group.

Name.documentation: The name of the rule group. You cannot change the name of a rule group after you create it.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entity.

Rules.documentation: The Rule statements used to identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count. Each rule includes one top-level statement that WAF uses to identify matching web requests, and parameters that govern how WAF handles them.

Scope.documentation: Specifies whether the rule group is for an Amazon CloudFront distribution or for a regional application. A regional application can be an Application Load Balancer (ALB), an Amazon API Gateway REST API, an AppSync GraphQL API, or an Amazon Cognito user pool.

VisibilityConfig.documentation: Defines and enables Amazon CloudWatch metrics and web request sample collection.

AwsWafv2RuleGroupDetails.documentation: Details about an WAFv2 rule group.

CustomRequestHandling.documentation: Defines custom handling for the web request, used when the CAPTCHA inspection determines that the request's token is valid and unexpired. For more information, see Customizing web requests and responses in WAF in the WAF Developer Guide..

AwsWafv2RulesActionCaptchaDetails.documentation: Specifies that WAF should run a CAPTCHA check against the request.

CustomRequestHandling.documentation: Defines custom handling for the web request. For more information, see Customizing web requests and responses in WAF in the WAF Developer Guide..

AwsWafv2RulesActionCountDetails.documentation: Specifies that WAF should count the request.

Allow.documentation: Instructs WAF to allow the web request.

Block.documentation: Instructs WAF to block the web request.

Captcha.documentation: Instructs WAF to run a CAPTCHA check against the web request.

Count.documentation: Instructs WAF to count the web request and then continue evaluating the request using the remaining rules in the web ACL.

AwsWafv2RulesActionDetails.documentation: The action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches a rule's statement. Settings at the web ACL level can override the rule action setting.

Action.documentation: The action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the rule statement. Settings at the web ACL level can override the rule action setting.

Name.documentation: The name of the rule.

OverrideAction.documentation: The action to use in the place of the action that results from the rule group evaluation.

Priority.documentation: If you define more than one Rule in a WebACL, WAF evaluates each request against the Rules in order based on the value of Priority. WAF processes rules with lower priority first. The priorities don't need to be consecutive, but they must all be different.

VisibilityConfig.documentation: Defines and enables Amazon CloudWatch metrics and web request sample collection.

AwsWafv2RulesDetails.documentation: Provides details about rules in a rule group. A rule identifies web requests that you want to allow, block, or count. Each rule includes one top-level Statement that WAF uses to identify matching web requests, and parameters that govern how WAF handles them.

CloudWatchMetricsEnabled.documentation: A boolean indicating whether the associated resource sends metrics to Amazon CloudWatch. For the list of available metrics, see WAF metrics and dimensions in the WAF Developer Guide.

MetricName.documentation: A name of the Amazon CloudWatch metric.

SampledRequestsEnabled.documentation: A boolean indicating whether WAF should store a sampling of the web requests that match the rules. You can view the sampled requests through the WAF console.

AwsWafv2VisibilityConfigDetails.documentation: Defines and enables Amazon CloudWatch metrics and web request sample collection.

Allow.documentation: Specifies that WAF should allow requests by default.

Block.documentation: Specifies that WAF should block requests by default.

AwsWafv2WebAclActionDetails.documentation: Specifies the action that Amazon CloudFront or WAF takes when a web request matches the conditions in the rule.

ImmunityTimeProperty.documentation: Determines how long a CAPTCHA timestamp in the token remains valid after the client successfully solves a CAPTCHA puzzle.

AwsWafv2WebAclCaptchaConfigDetails.documentation: Specifies how WAF should handle CAPTCHA evaluations for rules that don't have their own CaptchaConfig settings.

ImmunityTime.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, that a CAPTCHA or challenge timestamp is considered valid by WAF.

AwsWafv2WebAclCaptchaConfigImmunityTimeP.documentation: Used for CAPTCHA and challenge token settings. Determines how long a CAPTCHA or challenge timestamp remains valid after WAF updates it for a successful CAPTCHA or challenge response.

Name.documentation: The name of the web ACL.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL that you want to associate with the resource.

ManagedbyFirewallManager.documentation: Indicates whether this web ACL is managed by Firewall Manager.

Id.documentation: A unique identifier for the web ACL.

Capacity.documentation: The web ACL capacity units (WCUs) currently being used by this web ACL.

CaptchaConfig.documentation: Specifies how WAF should handle CAPTCHA evaluations for rules that don't have their own CaptchaConfig settings.

DefaultAction.documentation: The action to perform if none of the Rules contained in the web ACL match.

Description.documentation: A description of the web ACL that helps with identification.

Rules.documentation: The Rule statements used to identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count. Each rule includes one top-level statement that WAF uses to identify matching web requests, and parameters that govern how WAF handles them.

VisibilityConfig.documentation: Defines and enables Amazon CloudWatch metrics and web request sample collection.

AwsWafv2WebAclDetails.documentation: Details about an WAFv2 web Access Control List (ACL).

KeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS key that is used for encryption. Provided if Type is KMS.

Status.documentation:
The current status of the encryption configuration. Valid values are ACTIVE or UPDATING.

When Status is equal to UPDATING, X-Ray might use both the old and new encryption.

Type.documentation: The type of encryption. KMS indicates that the encryption uses KMS keys. NONE indicates the default encryption.

AwsXrayEncryptionConfigDetails.documentation: Information about the encryption configuration for X-Ray.

AutomationRulesArns.documentation: A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for the rules that are to be deleted.

ProcessedAutomationRules.documentation: A list of properly processed rule ARNs.

UnprocessedAutomationRules.documentation: A list of objects containing RuleArn, ErrorCode, and ErrorMessage. This parameter tells you which automation rules the request didn't delete and why.

StandardsSubscriptionArns.documentation: The ARNs of the standards subscriptions to disable.

StandardsSubscriptions.documentation: The details of the standards subscriptions that were disabled.

StandardsSubscriptionRequests.documentation: The list of standards checks to enable.
